review: Decent food like it's too expect from Red Robbin. I would give it a four just for the service. Our waitress and waiter were very friendly and helpful. They accommodated all the requests from my friends with a big smile in their face and I think that's a hard thing to find in a restaurant like this one specially in a busy Friday night. My only complaint was my almost 14 dollars shot.... It was just a shot of Jack and one of Jagger... Not worth it that much.....
I love red robin and this place is pretty good overall. The staff is friendly but slow most of the time in getting you drink refills or anything else you ask for.

As chain burger restaurants go this one was not bad. It's clean with fast service. Our waiter was nice and officiant. We got our drink and app quickly and our entrees not long after. We got the tower of onion rings which were really good. Hot crisp and crunchy. I got the bleu burger with blue cheese and onion straws on it. Overall it was cooked well and had good flavor. My SO got a burger with jalapeños on it and he seemed to enjoy it. He said it would have been better if raw jalapeño was put on it and not the fried coins but he still enjoyed it. Plus they had a fresh keg of Racer 5. I would come here again

How would you LOVE to wait nearly an hour and forty-five minutes after placing your order to be presented with a cold, less than desirable looking meal? Or better yet would you LOVE to have a waitress with a snobby attitude? If you answered yes to any of these questions, Red Robin in Vacaville CA is the place for you!      My family and I foolishly came to this establishment to celebrate my father's 60th birthday and boy was this a mistake!  Upon being seated,we were promptly greeted by a snooty waitress who rushed us to place an order. 45 minutes go by and nothing, no food, no refills, and no waitress.  As my family and I grow curious we notice other parties (some) with far more people than ours quickly getting their meals and even leaving. We wait another 15 minutes and still nothing. So we finally track down our waitress to politely ask about our meal and why parties after us were served before us, she snapped "well it's Saturday and I put their orders in first" and shrugs her shoulders.  Upset we decided to give it a few more minuted,30 minutes go by and we decided enough was enough. We gathered our things and began exiting our table. Just as we were getting ready to walk away the manager lazily came up to us with a tray of food that looked as if it had been sitting on the counter for an hour,forgotten, and ran through a microwave in an attempt to reheat.  By that time my family and I were extremely upset, and had no desire to continue our horrible dining experience.  Both the manager and waitress were condescending and tried their best to be little my family and I. If i had to choose between returning to this resturant and starving, I would choose starvation in a heartbeat. Word for the wise, you would probably recieve better customer service at McDonalds.

After a long anticipated wait to visit this location and giving up red meat for the Lenten season there couldn't be a better place than Red Robin for our Easter brunch. We arrived at 11:00am right when they opened and to our surprise unlike all the other place in the area there were no lines or wait times. We were seated right away and water was brought out shortly after. Our server (I wish I remembered her name now) was very friendly, checked on us often and provided above and beyond service. She took the time to explain the different between a vegetarian and boca burger to my mom, helped us place an order to go with appropriate timing and hooked us up with my refill to go. Who doesn't want a raspberry limeade to go?!? As always I ordered the Royal Red Robin Burger and it was fantastic. It was a perfectly medium cooked patty, stacked with applewood bacon, cheese and all its burger glory with a fried egg (the best part) between toasted buns. With the bottomless fries and raspberry limeade I truly enjoyed my meal and left with the most fulfilling feeling ever. Mmm!!! I know where I'm going for lunch today... Needless to say the food and service at Red Robin was superb and I had a food coma later that day.

i have a diasease that does not allow me to process food containing gluten. Red Robin claims to have a GLuten free menu wich i ordered from and got deathly ill from. when i complained to a manager days latter they told me a manager shouyld of come to the table and assure me he or she would make sure it was prepared GF. he then sent me a $20 gift card to re try. i eventually did and didnt get sick but service was horrible and the manager that day never came to the table i had to ask to speak to the manager to aasure my food was safe. not worth my tummy ache!!!

The food was pretty good but the service could have been better. To start off, we ordered salsa, guac, and chips to which there was a hair hiding in the salsa (yuck!). The meal was very good and very well prepared.  The Bleu Ribbon burger was fantastic as always. Our server was quick with refills for our drinks which is always a plus, however, toward the end of our meal the service started to fade.  Strong start but poor finish.  We had to ask several times for a box before we finally got one.  We ended up waiting 15-20 minutes for our server to finish up the whole process of getting us our bill, taking our money, and giving us a togo box.  Normally, this wouldn't be a problem but the place wasn't very busy.  Perhaps they are understaffed? Either way, customer service shouldn't be overlooked, especially in today's economy with the amount of choices each patron has. My advice, get your food togo, or else you will wait an unusually long time for mediocre service.

Went there for lunch with friends.  I ordered the vegetable soup after the server told me that there was no cheese in it (I'm lactose-intolerant).  When it arrived, lo and behold, there was a cheese on it!  So I asked the food runner to send it back and get me a new one.  20 minutes or so passed and still nothing!  My friends all got their food and I didn't mind as much because I ate their fries.  I finally just told the server to remove the soup from the bill because it took too long and I didn't want it anymore.  She asked, "Oh you never got it?"  Um...no.  Do you see a freaking bowl in front of me?   She was polite, pleasant, and quick with out refills, but she definitely did not get a good tip.  Her section wasn't even full; she wasn't double-sat with tables, so I don't understand how she could not have realized that a guest at one of her few occupied tables didn't receive their order.   I shouldn't have to flag her down to tell her.  I'm not a hardass customer, but I've worked at a much busier restaurant before and I've seen servers give much better service when they're being slammed with diners.

Service was fast. Went for birthday and couldn't get the advertised free burger. Was told to call contact the rewards merchant to resolve issue at another time. Ordered sweet potato fries that came with about 10 skinny fries and two big cups of dip. Food was not bad.

Don't do take out from here. Apparently manners, customers service and an ability to count aren't requirements for most of the staff working on take outs. We actually had get get help from a waitress who was on her way out the door  to go home (thnx BTW! You were super helpful when you didn't need to be :) ) The other TWO people we had spoken to were worthless.....total FAIL.  We will NOT be going back.

Why does anyone even bother to come here? On my way back to Sacramento after picking up a friend from San Francisco Airport we stopped by just to get a quick bite to eat and to take a bathroom break. Not that I was expecting fine dining or anything like that, but the deluxe cheeseburger is not worth what you pay for, the meat is flavorless, the bun has no texture and falls apart, the cheese is gelatinous and I paid $19.- plus tip for that crap.... Blechh !! They need to take lessons at In'n Out Burger or better yet just go to McDonald's.   One other thing: I do not like Country and Western music blasting in my ears when I am using the bathroom !!!
Great service and great food. Love the bottomless fries. 4/5 because there are not a lot of great specials.

I've been going to other Red Robin resturants for years & always loved the food & service, especially the seasoning salt that goes on the yummy fries. When this one opened up a little over a year ago, I was excited to have one near by. I've been there a hand-full of times during different hours & sat in different sections & must say they have the worst service I've ever experienced! The food was good, after waitng over 30 minutes for a burger each time, I'm over it! The service in the bar is horrible also. One night we sat in the bar section at a booth with friends(because there was a 30 wait for a table), we sat for at least 20 mins before anyone decided to come over & take a drink order. Our drinks came out at different times, my beer was flat! I asked for a different brand & it was flat too! After waiting for some time, we had to flag-down a waitress just to make an order.Another long wait for our food.... Our orders also came out at different times. My friends order finally came out after the rest of us were done with our food! No wonder there was such a long wait for a table, we were there for about 2 hours! My girlfriend reciently went with her daughter & warned her about the service, it was the same story. Not sure if I'll ever give this place another chance! Management needs to read all the horrible service reviews & fix the crappy service!!

We were trying to go to BJ's next store but they had an hour and a half wait.  I was with my girlfriends soccer team.  We had a party of 8 people.  We sat in the bar and ordered margarita cocktails that were awful.  We waited one hour on a waiting list. Nobody came around in that hour to see if we wanted to order any appetizers.  There was no waitress working in the bar area.  We finally pushed are tables together because we were starving.  The food was just okay.  Kind of reminded me of a upgraded version of Dennys.  But, when you have been in the sun all day and you are starving I guess you make the best of it.  The one star is for are food server, she was really nice.

Horrible service. Came here with my family one weekend and when we walked in, nobody came to help us or even acknowledge our existence, so we just stood there for a bit, hoping we'd be seen eventually. But that was wishful thinking. A few more minutes passed before I got fed up and I actually had to flag somebody down in order to help us. Once were seated,  my dad ordered some soup, and when he got it, it had gone cold, and he requested that they rewarm it. The waiter came back with the soup-still not warm enough. At that point my dad was irritated and he  requested that they just remake it completely. So they did. Horrible service, and i was shocked by the lack of professionalism at this location. Me and my family wont be coming back.
Everything is totally average.  Better off going to Five Guys or In and Out

I like red Robin food, and I have been here multiple times and had awesome experiences. However I went on my birthday with my family. The service was lacking. My dad ordered a Burger and everything he said he wanted the waiter talked him out of. We had to ask too many times for refills and the waiter was not very attentive at all. When the entrees came, everybody got their food except me. When the guy brought it out, the manager Rebecca came over and apologized for the wait (I ordered the pub crawl style and it had a special cheese spread that needed to be prepped, or at least that is what she said) but she took the Burger off of the bill. She even gave my dad a promotion for a free appetizer even though it was expired(his red card was old). Three stars for the food, five for the extremely nice manager, one for the server.

Stopped by here for lunch on a recent trip from the Bay Area to the Sierras.  Chose this place because I had heard they had a gluten free bun for their burgers.  Upon arrival, the service was great.  The hostess was friendly and sat us quickly with a smile.  The FOH manager (lovely young lady) heard us mention that we were very hungry and brought us some fries to tie us over until we ordered.  This is where the good experience ended. The waitress was unavailable and ignored our table for a long time.  We ordered two burgers, each with the GF buns.  It took over 20 minutes for our burgers to come out (in no world does it take this long to grill a burger to Med Rare) and when they did, they were COLD.  We complained and sent them back.  It took 10 minutes to get a second burger and when we did, they were terrible.  The burger tasted like it had been microwaved and the bacon on it was underdone and cold, so it just tasted like grease.  For a place where burgers are supposed to be the specialty, this is unacceptable.  Our waitress was never around and we had to go find someone to help us. The reason for two stars instead of just one is that the kitchen manager tried very hard to make good on this.  There was no charge for our lunch and the manager even gave us a gift card for a future visit.  I doubt I will ever return to a Red Robin after this experience and will give the gift card to a friend who might use it on her many road trips with the kids' soccer team. The issue here seems to be more with training.  The cooks have no idea on how to actually cook a burger and someone needs to tell the waitstaff to pick up there orders in a timely manner from the window.

Ive been to several robins in So cal. and loved them. They really have a good thing, red robin. But this particular red robin is just not up to par. ...Ive actually been there 3 times.  The first time our food seemed to be left over toppings from the day before... Not fresh.  Second time, we ordered our food and it came out in a reasonable time (10-15 mins)  but it was cold. Like, not even under a heat lamp and I got sick that night.  Third time, I wasnt to excited about going.... Me and my ex got sick later that night.,  I cant give them 2 stars because I expected to be satisfied and wasnt.  NEW MANAGEMENT!

Service is pretty pathetic here. The food is standard Red Robin (a step up from fast food). Still, this is Vacaville and there are not a ton of GOOD chain restaurants available (there ARE a ton of chain restaurants here--just not good ones). This makes Red Robin one of the better chain restaurants in Vacaville that I've been to. (Olive Garden is another.)

Red Robin... What can we say- we love the rewards program. Our Vacaville location is pretty good. Have had occasions when the servers weren't always very nice- we had one who just seemed annoyed to be there. Overall- we've had more good experiences than bad ones. We like the fries better when they're crispy- which is usually the case, but not always. They're not stingy with the side of ranch dressing. And they almost always get our burger orders right. We like the location and our kids like the kid menu. Like I said the rewards program is cool.

YUMM! Definitely a Red Robin fan. Everything on the menu is tasty, from the burgers to the wraps to the soups and salads. The speckled lemonade is great, and the waitress at this location came by with refills before we even needed them. I got a sauteed mushroom burger, and there were so many mushrooms on it they were overflowing! Great, since at other places they will give you 4 or 5 slices only. We also got the tower or onion rings appetizer, which were really good and had a couple of dipping sauces. Cant forget about the bottomless steak fries!! Its funny, Ive never had to order a second round of fries because there's just too much food, but just the thought of them being free makes me happy! BF got the burger with the fried egg on it (cant remember the name), but he didnt talk much so Im guessing he was too busy soaking up the deliciousness to do so. Ask to sign up for the RedRoyalty Rewards program! Its free, and they keep track of how many burgers you've ordered and how much you've spent there, and will give you free items and deals after so many points. My burger was actually free this time because we bought 9 and got one free :D They also give you a free burger during your birthday month.

Parking is decent.  Because its in a Restaurant area...right across and around other restaurants...parking is fairly easy...but not always RIGHT IN FRONT. I'm a red robin fan like no other. They do everything I like just the way I like it. This place actually seems better than all of the other Red Robins i've been to.  The waitress in the bar area tables IS EXCELLENT!!!  Wish I remembered her name, but it was my first time at this Red Robins and you would be lucky to have her be your waitress. We ordered Fish and Chips one with Sweet Potato Fries and one with the bottomless steak fries..both are bottomless. They gave quite a bit of fries...more than normal for Red Robins.  Really, I noticed the difference.  In fact, I noticed the .30 cent difference in the Fish and Chips price between vacaville and san bruno. I also love their Milkshakes...oreo cookie one..forgot the name. In fact, I usually get the strawberry lemonade...but they all fill me up. Come here because its worth it. THe only problem?  Its because because there are places to eat over here and away from the stores....so its VERY BUSY on weekends.

Fourth time giving this place a chance ......failure no.4 . Gluttons for punishment   I guess. Bottomless fries were a myth ....server had to be asked more than three times to get one serving. Asked for water ...never got it. We were told it was unusually busy ....we were told this the last three times as well. This is a burger and fries joint. At least you would think they could get fries out. Poor service , food was tolerable but after an hour and a half .....this place is a tragedy to Red Robins.

Eating a bowl of chili and a boozy shake; opted ordering a bowl of chili and lemonade instead.  I'm shocked it took 35 minutes receiving my food order!!!!  I got the waitress to put my chili in a to go bowl!  Terrible, horrible service!

Ok Red Robin in Vacaville....you lost me......  I remember when Red Robin had a massive burger menu and the continuous fries were large helpings......what happened???  It's like they streamlined everything and lost the umph.......I recall a menu with at least 12-15 different burgers, and fries which came by the basket load....now they only have like 5 burger choices....  On a recent visit I ordered the whiskey river chicken sandwich...which was fair.....when I asked for that delightful basket of fries I got a plate or whatever with about 6 fries...my wife had a mediocre chicken sandwich, which was better on a past visit...our friend Rose had a chicken wrap which irritated the hell out of her...it was served hot on a previous visit and was cold this time....frustrating...The staff was fine but the food was weak.... Sorry Red Robin,,,,,,you lost me.....next time I'll go to Applebee's, they seem to do ok......Chili's can bite me tho.... they hella blew it one too many times for me..... ...cheers!

Over the years IMO the quality of Red Robins food has declined over the years in general.  I have only been to this particular location once and I prob wont be back. I generally will stick with the one in Concord.  It took SOOOO long to get our food and there were only two of us! The food overall was decent and our waiter was pretty cool, it seemed like an issue of them having an unorganized kitchen. After we waited a long time for food, my friend's order wasn't even right! If I'm in Vacaville I will stick with BJ's across the parking lot

Take the entire family at least once a month( Fairfield, Vacaville, or Concord),great burgers, and Bottomless french fries, also love the strawberry lemonade.Join the club get free food on your birthday and various deals thru out the year definitely worth while.

Maybe I'm just lucky, but I've never had a problem at ANY of the Red Robin restaurants to which I've been. And my visit to this location in Vacaville was just great, mainly because of our super server, Janique.  We were seated in the bar, where Janique seemed to be handling all 452 tables by herself. Even so, she greeted us promptly, got our drinks to us promptly, took our order promptly, and kept our iced teas refilled; all the while being chipper and conversational. Let's just say, Janique earned herself a couple extra bucks on her tip! Oh, and the food was definitely to our liking! Being a Red Robin Royalty member, I get a free sandwich during my birthday month, which just happens to be May, so I ordered the mushroom/swiss with bottomless steak fries, which all came out hot and fresh (the bun was uber-soft, which I love). Hubby's soup and half sandwich came out with a FULL chicken caesar wrap, so he was stoked, and the chicken tortilla soup was given a thumbs up.  All in all, we really liked having lunch here after our shopping excursion at the Vacaville Premium Outlets. And you just can't beat free food for your birthday, right? Oh, and Janique noticed the birthday freebie when she ran our bill, which also means I could have received a free birthday sundae, but we were so full from lunch that we just gave it a pass. Come to find out Janique's birthday is the day before mine here in May...rock on, fellow Gemini!! :)

We only came to this location because the wait at BJ's across the lot was too long. We should have known better that it was almost empty - we were seated promptly and our food took a while, but it was good. I ordered one of their new bottomless watermelon spritzers, and finished it midway through the meal. My meal had jalapenos in it, and I was given no water. Once we finally got our server's attention to get another drink, it still took about 10 minutes before she returned to say she was waiting for it from the bar. It's not alcoholic, but whatever. By this point I'm eating ice just to cool down my mouth. Another 10 minutes goes by and by the time we could flag her down AGAIN, everyone was done eating. SO I said I still needed the drink, and  to-go box, and she got rather snippy, saying, "Well, I had to ring up another customer." I held my tongue and didn't point out that it doesn't take 20 minutes for a refill. After dinner, my daughter and I used the restrooms, and they were in HORRIFIC shape. It looked like there had been a TP fight in there, with rolls all over the floor, and none left in the stalls. The paper towel trash was overflowing onto the floor. My daughter said it reminded her of a rest stop we saw in the Mojave Desert. If a restaurant can't keep their facilities clean, you have to wonder about the cleanliness of the kitchen. I will never revisit, even if I'm starving.

At first I was a little turned off by our waitress....she seemed short and not really wanting to wait on us.  To complicate issues, another waiter came to our table and said that he was taking over the table.  It was not like she was leaving, she was till working tables around us and was working throughout our entire meal.  Gilbert however was an excellent waiter. He took our order, was quick on the drink refills and when the kitchen messed up the order he took care of it.  Overall I would have given a five-star review, but the first waitress' less then stellar service presented the four star

When both my 8.5 y.o. son and I both find lots of things we like on a menu, that's a sure sign the restaurant gets repeat visits.  Plus they have not only turkey burger option for everything but they also have a rotating spicy option or two every time I have been there.  Red Robin YUM

Our favorite family restaurant in Vacavillle.  Consistently good food, great service and a great price.  When you have a big family and need to watch your money, this is the best bang for the buck. The onion rings are the bombdiggity. Bottomless fries are you kidding me?   Bottomless root beer floats?  Hell yeah !    My family loves it and we always have a good time when we go out to Red Robin. Something for everyone if you are not down with burgers.  If you aren't down with burgers you are basically a communist and should be shot!  :)
Awesome food, great atmosphere!  Had the banzai burger!  Perfect!  Love Red Robin!

This is not the Red Robin of my youth or even the one in Fairfield.  Service was super slow, yes, I know in this economy that there's less servers to save money but 45 minutes is pushing it. Our burgers looked like anorexic hockey pucks.  My son's chicken strips were more of chicken strip and a half.  No worth the price. BUT, get the campfire dip for your fries.  That's tasty.

Came by this Red Robin on the way back from visiting relatives in the bay area. When we got there they must have been short handed because the hostess kept telling us to wait while she ran around the restaurant answering phones and going between the kitchen area and the dining room. After about 3 minutes of her Red Robin exercise routine we were seated. My Mom ordered some fish burger and I ordered a chicken burger. Now these burgers were listed as between $9.99 and $12.99 on the menu, so I was expecting these gigantic burgers. Boy were we disappointed. Both burgers had no taste to them at all, but at least the fries were good.  This was after it took 30 minutes for us to receive our order. I don't think I will be coming back here again just poor service and lack luster food with over inflated prices.

FIVE stars on food. I just don't like some of the new things that were changed. They no longer wrap the burgers, most burgers I get are messy and without the paper I made a huge mess. I'm also a messy eater. They give you so little fry's now. The menus have been updated and made into the same menus every other restaurant has. This location has let me down once but other than that one time they are great.
YUM!  Great place to eat. Just a bit pricey.

My son and I were looking for a good place to go eat last night, so when we passed Red Robin I decided to take him there. I used to eat at another location and remember how good the food was! When we walked inside this one, we had to wait a good 5 minutes while the initial host tried to find us a table. I was looking at all the empty tables wondering what the hold up was, but finally we were seated. The host and hostesses that we dealt with seemed pretty short, and not very friendly. Our waiter arrived and took our order and I could not find in the menu the buffalo wings that I used to love. I was assured by the waiter that they still served them, so placed a full order, and my son ordered chicken strips and fries from the children's menu. About 15 minutes later our food came out and I was surprised at the small serving size presented to my son. There was 2 small chicken strips and a handful of fries. The wings that I had ordered were NOT what I remembered, and the taste was very off. They were also very fatty and soaked in grease. I asked the waiter if these were indeed buffalo wings, as they were not what I thought I was getting. He then informed me that there was recent recipe changes and that they now go with this recipe where regular wings were tossed in a "zing" sauce. The sauce was oil based and not very tasty. He then offered to bring me out a side of the sauce. I have a feeling they have encountered this complaint numerous times. He apologized for the inconvenience and we finished our meal, not very happy at all about the quality of the food or service. We will not be re-visiting this location and will stick with our favorite places from now on.

When in Rome, do as the Romans do. What that translates to in Vacaville is dining at a corporate chain casual dining restaurant. For me & a lifelong friend meeting here in town, that's how we ended up being at Red Robin. I mean, this being Vacaville & all, your choices pretty much boil down to 1 variation on a theme or another of a Chotchkie's or a Flingers. We actually tried to go Fresh Mex 1st but that place was too busy. This place, on the other hand, had open tables & open seats at the the bar. We sat at the bar. Service from the bartenders was unremarkably OK. I ordered a Fiery Ghost Style Big Tavern Burger & we split an order of Towering Onion Rings. Our food didn't take too long. The Towering Onion Rings were served 1st. $9 seemed like a lot for this appetizer, but the Onion Rings were quite crunchy tasty & were served with 2 delicious dipping sauces. Since Red Robin's theme is burger joint & they make the "best burger" claim,  I was curious about how well they would perform in 2 aspects of my Burger: doneness & spiciness. I ordered my Burger cooked medium & it was supposed to have a Ghost Pepper sauce. The bun & veggies on my Fiery Ghost Style Big Tavern Burger were good. The burger patty, however, was slightly overcooked to medium well & needed more seasoning. Surprisingly, the Ghost Pepper sauce was actually respectably spicy hot with a nice smoky flavor. To wash down my Burger & Onion Rings, beer was the natural choice. The tap selection was much more macro than micro so I decided Guinness was the way to go. Now, there is a specific way to pour a Guinness correctly & the bartenders here had no idea how to do it. At the Red Robin in Vacaville, the Towering Onion Rings were good but pricey. The Fiery Ghost Style Big Tavern Burger was OK overall. & the way the bartenders poured Guinness would seriously piss off an Irishman. I know. I've had Guinness at Guinness' Gravity Bar in Dublin, Ireland. They take it seriously there & I guess I do too.
A friend recommended going to the Fairfield location instead of Vacaville. The service TERRIBLE. Will never return.

What can I say Red Robin has always had some amazing burgers!  The girlfriend and I usually take a trip to the Robin located in Vacaville due to the fact it's just a jog down the road.  This location you are never waiting any longer then 15 minutes to have a table, especially if you're feeling spicy and wanting to sit at the bar, and maybe have a drink or two!  On to the menu, of course you have to get the Royal Robin Burger! The freshly cooked egg over the burger makes everything just worth it, and of course you can never forget the bottomless fries!  Red Robin is always a 5/5!

The service at this location has been very poor for the last two visits now. Today the food was ok but we waited for about 10 minutes just to get greeted by the server after being sat right away. It took another 20 minutes to get the food. Although the food was good, we had to ask multiple times and wait long periods for refills of fries and beverages. We won't be back to this location.

Red Robin is known as the #1 Best Burger! When you are given this title, I expect you to know ALL types of burgers.  It all better be good. I remember when I use to eat beef.  The burger here was good but messy, but then again if it doesn't get all over the place, it doesn't belong on your face.  I would always order the chicken Caesar wrap, which was excellent!!  The bottomless steak fries are so addicting. During my last trip here, I was extremely disappointed.  I ordered the vegan burger, which was HORRIBLE.  Dried and no flavor.  It's probably like eating cardboard, if I ever ate cardboard.  I had to drink lots of water to get this meal down.  My family ordered the regular beef burgers and chicken burgers some of them liked it and other did not.  The universal complaint we had was it was too dry. Sadly, I will not be going back to Red Robin for a vegan burger.   Service was great at first until our waitress said she had to go on a break and someone else was going to wait on us.  After that the service went down hill.   If you plan on ordering any burger here, make sure to order something that has lots of sauce or have them add extra sauce.  Otherwise, you might choke on their burgers.
I love red Robin... Specifically I enjoy their fries... and dipping said fries in their pepper corn sauce... Must try it... Go.  Overall their burgers are good, and I have never left disappointed

My favorite, the bacon cheeseburger, is stil worthy of five stars.  Their service, however, is not, so I have to bump down the rating to a three.  Service has gone downhill since they opened.  We received perfect service on one of our first visits, almost too perfect that our server was probably a corporate trainer assisting during their opening.  There was another server, Cheyenne, who was really good and worked there for awhile, but I haven't seen her lately.  In the beginning a manager would stop by each time to check in which was a nice touch, but not anymore. Most of the servers working at this Red Robin now are friendly, but things like not bringing our appetizer out until after our burgers have been brought out is unacceptable.  It is no longer an appetizer and pretty much defeats the point.  Another time our appetizer was brought out but not any small plates, and our server kept forgetting our requests.  And not that it was our server's fault, but we had to wait awhile for our drinks one time because there weren't any clean glasses available.  As for the hosts/hostesses, some are friendly; others, not so much.  We had one hostess seat the family that came in after us before us, and when she did seat us she put us at the worst table in the restaurant.  We did not have a good feeling after that.   I love their bacon cheeseburger and their Red Royalty rewards card is pretty good, so I can keep coming back because of those things.  But there is definitely room for improvement when it comes to their service, and if it does happen, I can bump up the rating again.
Food is yummy but the restaurant is ALWAYS freezing! !!!! Infact we chose NOT to go here tonight with our family because of that! :(

If you feel like having to force down some burnt rib-lets, and some dry azz chicken that tastes like flour then let me suggest this place, you will be shooting a milkshake out your butt in the morning!!!!! Maybe I should of had a burger??? The fries were good...

I've tried eating here multiple times and after my last bad experience, cannot find myself wanting to give it another chance. The service is the main reason that this place rated so low. The food is nothing to write home about, and seeing as the name suggest gourmet, it should be.  You can get a variety of burgers and bottomless fries but if your service is terrible your entire experience is going to dictate that.
Sat at the bar tonight. The bartender Ariel was spot on. Always made sure we were well take care of. My burger was pretty amazing  and I even got a free milk shake for my birthday.

I've always had really good food at this location, but the service can be a little off kilter sometimes. Good luck getting a refill for the bottomless fries! The thing that bugs me the most about this place is that if you arrive anytime around 4:30-5:30, the host will always try to seat you in the bar. I DON'T WANT TO SIT IN THE BAR! Especially if I bring my 75 year old mother with me!

I usually have had bad experiences with Red Robin but this outlet is clean, updated and food is relatively good for a chain.  Fish and chips and burgers satisfy when you are driving back from Tahoe ski trip.  Service was excellent and drinks were sharp and tasty.
I think for a chain restaurant it is one of the best! The burnin love burger with garlic fries is my favorite!

The dirty touchscreen tablets that we are supposed to use to order were awful. Anytime I tried to reorder a drink it errored out, even splitting the check it didn't read our payment cards...awful. Drinks took awhile to come out initially but the refills didn't take super long. They were pretty busy but service greatly dipped. Fry refills took ages. Also our table had no condiments or utensils and were stuck waiting 10 minutes for a spoon to enjoy our shake with. 1 star is for the drinks and fries only. My burger was decent but not whole lot of flavor and I LOVE RED ROBINS. This one was a disaster and weirdly laid out.

Great place and I LOVE going here. The food is consistently good and only very rarely have I had something wrong in my meal when it's brought out to me (and I eat there a lot). I always have good service and it's just generally a pleasure to eat at this establishment. One of my favorite restaurants around Vacaville!

"We give them to our managers, they put them away." Credit cards belong to the customer, not the managers!  Child-like waitress tells me this after I had to drive 45 minutes back to the restaurant because they did not give me my credit card back when I paid. Must  happen alot, since they have a stash of them.  Missed out on an important event because of it. And it was soooo not worth it.  The stale bun on my burger separated halfway through eating it.  Couldn't imagine having to ask for a another bun top, so I just left it.   Never, ever again.

The service here is hit or miss. If your starving I would avoid this place, because you could get your food hot and correct quickly OR it's crap, wrong and cold...I don't like to play Russian roulette with my meals. If my GF wants to go here I will, but mainly I avoid it. If I'm paying for a meal out, I want to enjoy it ALL of the times , not 50 percent. I literally walk in the place saying " wonder what it's gonna be like this time?"

They've added these terrible tablet devices to every table. The idea is drink, appetizer and paying of the bill convenience. We might as well just go pick up our food from the kitchen too, then we wouldn't have a need for a waiter or waitress either. These flashy devices only cause problems with kids at the table.  We asked the hostess to remove the device from our table based on our previous experience with the device at a restaurant across the street from this location. We won't be back due to the tablets being added to the table. We want a more personable dining experience.

I love the burgers in this place. Recently the restaurant has gone through some changes!! The restaurant is beautiful but the service is HORRIBLE!!! With no people in restaurant we waited in a corner table to have waitress even notice us for our drinks. The food took over 30 minutes this was the worst service I have experience in this new remodel place. I will not be going back to this restaurant. The staff looked confused and where more concern with personal conversation than guest.

I'm a bit conflicted writing this review because my first two experiences here, just over a year ago, were pretty good.  I liked my burgers a lot, and the service was extremely quick & friendly.  Now, a year later, I am compelled to ask what the fuck changed... Not for nothing, why was the service slow and my burger whack this time?  I mean the place was pretty empty so there was no reason for the slow service; and my burger was a heaping pile of dry, but nicely seasoned, shit.  Definitely not what I remembered.  It seems there's an explanation as to why this place was pretty empty at lunchtime.  Fuhgeddaboudit!

Yeah so what I went to two different red robins in a month so sue me.  I go here because I like my Boca burgers with variety. There were not many people here and it was kind of dead which is the way I like places. We sat in the bar and while our waitress was nice and chatty she seemed like she was new. She brought our appetizers and no plates or napkins so we had to wait until our food arrived  because she disappeared. By the tiem we got to eat our appetizers they were cold. I do not like those machines that you have to check yourself out.  You go out  so you can be served. Red Robin I am not a employee, do not make me ring my own check .

Service is slooow.  They could at least give you free games as you wait for food.  No utensils. Food was fine, not worth 30 minute wait. How  can you not have fries ready when menu offers endless?  Won't be coming back to the Vacaville Red Robin -- NOT worth the wait.
Great experience.. The food was awesome and came out quick. The server was on point and was always there when we needed her. Overall I was impressed

The food is good. That's about all, service sucks, takes forever. If you want a quick meal you should not come here. An hour for food to come out and it's not even that warm on a slow night? I hate this Red Robin and will never return to this piece of garbage establishment. Oh and milkshakes will take 30 minutes to make also... By the way this is my 3rd time here and it's always like this.

The only reason why I can't give this place a higher rating is that the all-around service is below what you'd expect from a chain establishment. First off, there is nothing wrong with the food quality or taste. Tastes great just like at any other typical Red Robin. When we arrived for lunch on a Monday afternoon, the place was far from bustling. We have a 3-year-old and she was not offered a kid's menu nor crayons/coloring sheet to play with. What got me a bit riled up was the fact that our order took, oh by my best estimate, at least 25 minutes to come out. I'm not sure what the hold up was, but again, the place was not busy. A little assurance or update by the wait staff in regards to our order would have been appreciated. Anyway, the only cool thing going for this place are those mini-iPad type devices at every table where you can order appetizers, drinks, and pay your bill. Seriously, with convenience like this, why would you need an inept wait staff?

On our way back from Reno, I persuaded my boyfriend to come here after finding the wait at BJs was at least 30 minutes. I was feeling nostalgic for the fries, and hadn't been to a Red Robin in years. Thankfully, they did not disappoint; the fries came out warm and perfectly seasoned (though a bit late, and the sweet potato fries were incredibly subpar). Like many other reviewers of this location, I felt that the quality of service did not match the excellent quality of the food, but the server certainly redeemed himself by being much more attentive later in the experience (we even got more fries without asking) and his demeanor seemed became more relaxed. Overall, the service did not interfere so much with the quality of the food that I felt the need to drop the rating anything below 4 stars. Good on Red Robin for maintaining delicious burgers and fries and also infusing some character in the interior design of the restaurant, despite it being a chain.
This was an awesome experience. Waitress Adrianna was perfect willing to help and answer questions. Service was quick and everything was clean. Definitely recommend
Liz the hostess is super cool, really nice.  We asked for a booth and she made sure a booth got cleaned and got us seated ASAP.

Unfortunately our waitress was very slow and did not check up on us after our food was served. Luckily, nothing was wrong with our order and the food was great. But we needed another order of fries and fruit.  We ended up talking to the manager and had received everything we ordered. We'd just been in there longer than we hoped. Ended up staying for an hour and a half. But food was great.

I took my Mom for her birthday on July 23rd. We view RR as a good go to place which has always been consistently good. This time, not so much. We were lead to two tables which were dirty. The third table was least dirty so we were sat there. The "ziosk" electronic order/pay thing was sitting askew on the table and it looked like all the days crumbs had been pushed under there. Disgusting. I was hoping my Mom did not notice. The server arrived promptly and was nice. Our drinks came and we ordered. Then we waited. We never saw anyone that looked like a manager and our server didn't come back for a very long time. When the food arrived it was dry, cool and had the appearance of sitting under a heat lamp. The server nervously giggled and advised there were some large parties up front. Clearly she meant, the large parties took priority over us! The server came back once after that first bite and then disappeared. My Mom wanted more fries, never happened. I would've liked new fries as mine were cold and wilty! I paid the bill via the ziosk thing but my mom wanted a box. I hit the server call button and the server finally came so I could ask for a box. She dropped the check which I informed her I already paid. The next day I received a request to complete a survey. I filled it out and asked to be contacted by someone from the company. Still waiting for that call!! Clearly I would not recommend this Red Robin to anyone.

This Red Robin used to be TGI Friday's back in the day so it is more spacious then some other locations of the popular burger chain. Most of the times there is no wait but the parking can take a while because there are businesses such as BJ's and Golden 1 in the same lot  I came here for lunch with a bunch of co-workers and they had no problems accommodating our group of 8 on a large table close to the TV. The service was prompt but not extraordinary by any means. We had to ask several times to get refill on their bottomless fries. If the fries are bottomless and there is a large group it would be expected to bring out more than two portions, furthermore since all of us had burgers that come with refillable fries. If this is something Red Robin prides itself on, they can clearly do better. Even being frugal does not really explain it.  For my meal I had a Burnin' Love burger, which comes with fried jalapeno rings, pepper jack, lettuce, tomato, and chipotle aioi on a corn crusted kaiser bun. Sounds mouthwatering, doesn't it? Well, while the burger wasn't bad, and they got the patty temperature right, it still did not impress me. The bun was a little on the dry side and the heat level from jalapenos, pepper jack and chipotle aioli was barely noticeable. WIth these ingredients I was expecting the burger to be the bomb but it was only solid. As for the brews to go with that burger, the beer selection at Red Robin is not bad for Vacaville, a town that is clearly missing a place that carries decent taps. They had about 10 handles, but the best beers I could find were Sam Adams Rebel and Lagunitas IPA. Sad fact is that on the West Coast we need to have imitation of WestCoast IPA (yes Rebel) while there are so many IPAs brewed in the same area/County. Suggestion to Red Robin: how about carrying Heretic brews? It doesn't get much more local then that for quality beer in Solano County.  Red Robin was OK for a lunch with co-workers and no one left hungry. For more than a 3 star rating things should be somewhat outstanding and Red Robin did not deliver that level or food/drinks/service.

Had a problem when I went to eat there last week. Mether the Manager called me and resolved it immediately. Very happy with the way it was handled and I will go back again. Thank you so much for your attention to resolving my issue with your store. I will let my friends know how well you treated us. Thanks again, Randy..

The worst service and unprofessional atmosphere I've been in at any restaurant, let alone a national chain. We were not greeted upon entering, so chose to sit in the bar. Big mistake. The bartender never spoke to us, our server didn't come until we asked for her, and had to ask twice for a refill of water. But the worst part was the obnoxious employees on break, talking about boyfriends and getting drunk.

We just went here yesterday night. We never received kid menus for our children, my kids had to ask for color crayons for the activity paper they received.    Their mac&Cheese was disgusting my kids said. My husband ordered the blue cheese burger which he said was gross. I had ordered a Southwest Chicken Salad which by the way I never received (manager took it off the check) never received our  Bottomless Root beer Floats  ( manager took that off as well)    The Mai Tai I got was so good :-)    Our waitress wasn't all that friendly, she seemed frustrated and irritated. Water spilled all over me, table and floor because the table was slanted. (Manager took care of this as well)    Now will I ever return to this Red Robin or Fairfield Red Robin Never Ever Again

Very disappointed in this location, had better hopes for this location because the Fairfield location has really poor service. Really wanted to eat here but there was No Hostess to attend to the guest. I was aware that the staff was busy and they had people waiting. However I had to wait 12 minutes just for the hostess to say that it would be an hour wait. The host is the first person customers make contact with, and should the easiest job to maintain. I understand staffing can sometimes be an issue but there shouldn't be any at the front. Tonight they left many customers hanging. I still would rather wait at BJs across the street.
Good food, good service.  Manager was nice, engaging with the guests.  I recommend the clucks and shrimp. Clean place. Kaylie was really nice

If I could give 0 stars, I would. My friends clam chowder was cold! Her chicken in her wrap was pink! We waited for our food for almost an hour, after that, it was another 20 minutes for our utensils.... Brittany was the worst server ever! No smile no customer service at all!! First we didnt get the utensils because she couldnt find them.... Then her excuse was because they just finished washing them. We asked for ranch more than 5 times to various servers, and didnt receive it until we got upset. The store barely  had any customers in the store, and yet the wait time was so extrenuous. Cold food! Bad service!!! The best thing was the free water! Plus the fries...

Had dinner with family at Red Robin our server Ryan was slow and ignored us at time we needed him. I ordered a Long Island and got a lemonade.  I asked Ryan for a proper long island he took the drink and never came back with another one. After about twenty minutes, I asked for my drink and he finally brought back my original drink lemonade. If you like horrible service, I strongly recommend Red Robin in Vacaville.

Who in their right mind would spend their hard earned cash here? The wings were good but their burger will unsettle your stomach and leave you burping up butter and grease and onion ( even though their is NO onion on your burger) and I make better frozen steak fries in my freezer.  Waitress was awesome.

I have to say that I haven't eaten at a Red Robin in a while. Wow, not the same product I remember!  The burger was dry and the equivalent of any bad fast food I can get anywhere.  The generous basket of fries has been reduced to a "cuff" of fries. (They will give you more if you ask....if you can find your overworked server) I won't be eating at Red Robin in Vacaville again. I might try somewhere else but I'm worried...

Horrible experience. First they bring out the wrong food, then they decide we're drinking something different and bring out wrong drinks... Then they ignore us through meal. Then they push us out when were about to ask for something and just interrupt and say "I'll bring you your check." Didn't know we had to be pushed out... Then they drop the check and never return for it. Had to go get up to find someone to pay. Horrible experience. Never returning.

I'm only giving 1 star because I have to. Listen to all the reviews on here. Service is horrible! We came to celebrate a birthday party and we were a party of 11. We were not rude and patiently waited. The restaurant was not crowded at all. We waited about 15 min for our waitress to come and had to tell her we were ready to order.  She was rude and didn't even seem like she wanted to help us. At one point we had a separate to go order so I wanted to ask for a menu. She didn't come around so we pressed the call server button on the order screen. She finally came after another 30 min and I asked for a menu and water and she said ok walking away. And I even had another refill to tell her. So rude!! Finally when we told her we wanted to order, she rudely says "I know she wants to order and I have a lot of complaints and things going on right now" and mind you, the manager was talking to a table next to us (also had complaints about the same server) and the manager tapped her shoulder to walk away. THIS WAS EMBARASSING TO US. IT WAS OUT LOUD IN THE RESTUARANT AND JUST DOWN RIGHT UNPROFESSIONAL. The manager knew what happened so she came to talk to us. The manager also didnt seem to care and said the proper words to make us feel better (I apologize, I'm sorry, we will have a talk with her, this is on me) but it did not help. The manager is rude as well with a condescending smile and better believe NONE of us gave a tip. We didn't even want to deal with her during paying our check so we all used the machine. I bet this is the same waitress everyone on here is complaining about- GINA is her name!  Tip: Red Robin- train your employees and if they can't handle a large party, don't it to them. Next time we will go to the Fairfield location only.

This review is based on customer service. First off let me say I like Red Robin, so when we decided to stop at this location, I was expecting the same awesome customer service. Boy was I wrong!!! When we first walked in, the hostess rudely ignored us. We stood there for at least a minute or two before she said how many? Then she proceeded to tell us there would be a 10 to 15 minute wait, which wouldn't have been an issue if they were super busy. But they weren't. So anyway we finally got seated at an empty table that had been empty the whole time. Shortly after a waitress rushingly says "I'll be right with you" as she walks on by. Then about 5 minutes later (probably a little longer), I guess the manager comes by (only because I said something loud enough for her to hear as she walked by) and says "oh your waitress will be with you shortly. But in the meantime can I take your drink orders" So I proceed to order our drinks. She brings them pretty quickly. Still haven't seen or met our waitress. The manager then saw me looking at the order tablet at the table and said "did your waitress explain this to you?" I said "no we don't even know which one she is." The manager or assistant manager (the same woman) then asks to take our food orders. We order. We have been there about 25 mins or so still waiting. Still haven't met our waitress even though everyone around us is being served and taken care of. Then at the hostess station the phone starts ringing. It literally rang for about 15 minutes. The hostess and another higher up both continued to ignore the ringing phone even though they could clearly hear it. Finally someone answers the phone. Annoying. Still have no idea who or where our waitress is. Suddenly after staring her down, low and behold I guess it was our waitress as she walked by she asked "what kind of drink did you have?" I'm thinking to myself, um and who are you? She never said hi, sorry I missed you or sorry for taking so long or even telling us her name. At that point I had it with the poor customer service. I get it that the manager was trying to help her but for whoever our waitress was supposed to be, to not ever even introduce her self at all or say anything to us ever is just rude. When you feel like your being treated poorly you lose your appetite. We asked to cancel the orders and said we would pay for the drinks we already drank. The manager was nice and said don't worry about it and sorry that we had a bad experience (something like that). Anyway we weren't the only ones that had walked out, several families walked out before even being seated. This is my own experience, but an honest opinion.

- filthy bar, tables  - terrible service  - drunk patrons the staff joked w/  - manager nowhere to be found  - miserable customers  I'd carry a 100lb bag of cement on my back and walk to the Red Robin in the mall before I'd ever give this establishment another nickel.

Wish I could give them zero stars. Terrible service. Always seated in the back. Funny how all the front tables had white families and all the back tables had Black and ethnic families. When I asked the manager about my concerns, he laughed at me. Never coming back.

This review is dedicated to Chase which is the only reason why it's 5 stars! My husband and I (and friends) frequently visit this location and have always had an average experience but one day, we had the pleasure of having Chase as our server. Well, since then, whenever we go in for some Red Robin burgers, we always ask if Chase is available and if so, request to be seated at one of his tables. Our dining experience with him is great because he has a great attitude and ensures his tables are well-served and taken care of throughout the course of the meal.  Red Robin appeals to me because I get my gluten free burger fix. Their veggie patties are great (not a meat eater) and being gluten free means that I have limitations. This location always does a great job with my "complicated" order of the Royal Red with a veggie patty, no bacon, pepper jack cheese, on gluten free bread and a well done egg - and then cut in half. Yeah, I know, not so easy! But this location always seems to get it right and I leave a very satisfied customer.

This is how it went down....was seated in the empty front room, took 10-15 mins. for the server to appear....then we were told silverware was being washed.  Food came out and still no silverware had to ask the Hostess for them.  We had asked for mustard, think server forgot not sure why section wasn't busy at all...so we asked Manager passing by..... So within at least 10 min. food was not even halfway finished, server brings the check really? How did she know we didn't want desert or additional drinks from bar which we did??? I will say food is just "ok" but their service is not even up to standard.  Pls re-train servers! That makes a whole lot of a difference!  Good evening....

"Dread Robin" - Robbin' & steal'n... I'm a big fan of Red Robins, the service here was great BUT the food & drinks were not up to the usual Red Robin standard. I've been to a number of Red Robins & never left feeling disappointed, everything was on point but here, the food/drinks were "Hit & miss."  As we walked in, Nicole, the hostess, greeted all of us and seated us promptly. She was very friendly & courteous. Our server, Veronica was equally helpful as well. Its been a while since I've eaten @ Red Robins and I was really looking forward to finally getting a chance to check out this one in town... The 3 Star Rating was a bit surprising but I was going to give it a try anyway. (Huh, what'daya know?... Verdict: 3 Stars) 'And after browsing other Red Robin locations & yelp*views, a pattern can be seen, it appears that Red Robin Gourmet Burgers has become quite comfortable with "average." When I used to frequent RR more often in Orange County, a solid 4 Star rating, no doubt... Now, it seems that things are amiss. I expected better, consistent preparation of the food & drinks... 'The best thing we had on this day was the service. Overall, it was "Okay." The Fireball Peach Smash sounded great! Menu description: "A delicious explosion of FIREBALL Cinnamon Whisky, peach purée, lemon wedges, fresh mint, and fresh, house-made sweet & sour." ($6.49)  Photo -  Unfortunately, the description sounded better than it actually was. I ordered a double but the drink tasted as is it was a single served in a glass twice the size. Fail. (I'm sure this is a great drink if it was properly made.) Now, the virgin margarita ordered in our group was a sure winner! After all, how do you mess up a drink that consists of margarita mix & blended ice?... (Insert buzzer sound here) WTH?! Congratulations Red Robin's bartender, you somehow found a way! The drink was weak, needed more mix... 'Watered down. (A lot like my Peach Smash.) Fail, again. EL ordered the Guacamole Bacon Burger - Menu description: "Guac, bacon, Swiss, tomatoes, lettuce, onion and mayo. No wonder you'll be grinning after the first bite"  ($10.49) I had the Burnin' Love - Menu description: "Topped with fried jalapeño coins, salsa, Pepper-Jack, lettuce, tomatoes and chipotle aioli on a jalapeño cornmeal kaiser roll. It's love at first bite." ($10.49) JK ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger - Menu description: "The one that made us famous. Featuring Red's pickle relish, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, pickles, mayo and choice of cheese." ($8.99) The Guacamole Bacon Burger was tasty but a thin spread of guacamole does not make a "Guac Burger." So, you drop a dollop of guacamole & on a patty and call it a Guacamole Bacon Burger? FAIL, numero tres.  "Where's the guac?!" -    The Burnin' Love Burger did not disappoint, it had a bit of heat but I was hoping for more of a kick. The burger was perfectly cooked, med-rare w/good flavor. The Burnin' Love comes with a deep fried, whole jalapeño on the side, and the heat the burger was lacking was made up here... 'All in one bite. 'HOT DAMN! "Yep, that did it!... Houston, we have ignition!!"Ahhhhh!..." It's about time I eat something that's so-called, spicy, that's actually "SPICY!" I thoroughly enjoyed the Burnin' Love that was recommended by our server, Veronica. (Nicely done.) Photo -  The report that I received on the Red Robin Gourmet Burger was a big thumbs up.  The "Bottomess Fries," cooked perfectlyt!... But when the pomme frites are buried in salt, to the point you're dusting them off, junk. Fail, numbre quatre. What are they seasoning the fries with, a shovel? Fireball Peach Smash (Double): "M'eh; weak; waste $ Coke Virgin Margarita: "M'eh"; weak; needed more margarita mix Guacamole Bacon Burger: Okay; good burger; BUT "Where's the guac'?!" Burnin' Love: Good; a bit of heat; awesome deep fried jalapeño  Red Robin Gourmet Burger: Good Steak Fries (Bottomeless): Fair portions; too salty Garlic Fries: Fair portions; too salty; NOT garlic bits, rather garlic seasoning Grand Total (+ Tip): $67 Red Robin used to have a slight edge to its rivals especially since the price point is a bit higher but after my recent visit, it's merely become "One of the boys." The "Hit & miss" items ranging from the weak, $12 "Double" Fireball Peach Slam, a diluted virgin margarita, the "Guacamole Burger Spread," to the salt sticks, (i.e. - Fries), just left an overall, somber feeling of WTF?! You can get a good burger at In & Out or Carl's just down the street... 'And not pay $11 for it. (Sigh) 'Too bad, "D'read." - Aloha! Food/Drinks: 3- Ambiance: 3 Service: 4 Value: 2+

Have given this location more than enough opportunities to turn my review around. The last 3 times we have been here, now 4th including today, we've gotten a portion of our food for free. Well here we go again....... Silverware, and napkins got to the table, after we were served... Drinks were not refilled until manager came over......my wife walked up to their beverage station to get our napkins, an employee watched her and didn't even comment or offer to assist. Why do we keep coming back? Enjoy the punishment maybe? We enjoy the food at many of this chains locations and even here when it's not cold...... Just keep hoping that the latest management change will make things better, that service will improve, and that the excuses will stop. I will ask others if this happens because my family is done......

Best burgers in town all u can  eat frys full bar tvs great place to take a family or just go have a few beers and watch a game must try my favorite is the bacon burger with American cheese lettuce tonato mayo

Server was average, food was below average. I ordered the black & bleu burger which is part of their new promotion for America's finest burgers or something. Super overpriced for what it is. The burger is 14.29 without tax, and I asked to sub their regular fries for their new herbed garlic fries, and got charged an additional $.99 even though my friend made the same sub (albeit on a different burger) and did not get charged for it. The burger was just okay, nothing special especially when I'm paying for what's supposed to be one of their "premium" burgers. Tried their raspberry cream soda (not bottomless) and they didn't even top up the glass with the soda all the way. Their version of the cream soda just seemed like regular raspberry Italian soda with whipped cream on top that you're supposed to stir in. For a drink that's almost $4 and not bottomless, I at least expect my glass to be topped up. Just my check was $20+ not including tip. For that price I would have rather gone to BJs, or better yet saved myself $12 and gone to chipotle. Splitting checks for 10 was super easy though so props to that. Will definitely not return to any red robin again, as I'm in general not a fan of the chain and their food.

I'm upgrading the stars because the owner contacted me regarding my experience. I feel like she does care about her business and will address this problem which is enough for me. I will give Red Robin another shot in the future.

I came here last night with my family around 9:00 PM. We weren't sure if we were supposed to be seated by a hostess or find ourselves a table because we had waited about 10 minutes before someone came to welcome us. Our server was nice, yet unattentive even if there weren't many customers. She was slow in attending our drink and fries refills even though we had altogether only ask for 1 drink refill and 2 fries refills. Additionally, while I know Red Robin's is primarily a hamburger joint, she seemed perplexed when we asked for basic utensils (fork, knive, and napkins). Food itself was very mediocre. I had asked for a medium cheese hamburger, but it was more well done--very dry and burnt. Never again!
Ew!  My BFF had paper, yes paper, in her burger.  Cook did not peel the paper off the tomato.  She'd eaten half of the burger too.  Manager was a great sport about it, but lay what a misstep!

Those tablet kiosk are horrible. It gives them an excuse to be less attentive and provide a poor experience.  When I asked for our check they said it would be faster if we just used the tablet. Horrible, Horrible, Horrible.

Never have I been so disappointed and disgusted with a restaurant. Our server was really slow. Patrice was her name. My brother in law was done with his burger before they brought him his fry refill, and we asked for them when they brought the food out.  My dad never got his water refilled until we were all done eating and we had to ask for it. My wife and I ordered a milk shake and alcoholic beverage which didn't come until way after are food. Oh and we had to ask for it.  It was our sister in laws birthday and the wouldn't except her reward because it wasn't 24 hours after she signed up for it. Not only that but they didn't sing for her or give her a sundae. We called after we left and they said they do that for birthdays. The manger was rude and acted like she didn't care. Bad customer service.  I cant believe this place.  I'm telling everyone I know to never go there.      Oh and online prices are different then on the menu and won't honor.  FALSE ADVERTISING! !!  We asked for our drinks more then once and are bill. Party of 5 and our bill was around 100. You think they would take better care of big paying customers. Wow.  Disgusting.  Wish I could give negative stars.  When she came by with the water refill she didn't have the water and asked if we wanted it in a to go cup like she was rushing us out.  Rude!  I can say the back of the house held their end up but front of the house sucks. No wonder this place has 2. 5 stars management don't know how to take care of their business.

I dunno if it's just THIS particular Red Robin, but I remember the Food and Service being WAYYY better before! Cuz this time seemed like one big Waiting game.  On a Friday night, the wait for a party of 4 was 45 minutes. It was so chaotic and unorganized cuz helllla folks were standing around waiting to be seated, yet when I looked around there were plenty of open tables available. We waited so long, my friends snagged a table and we ended up seating ourselves. Then we waited more to get a server's attention just so we could get menus. Instead of ordering off the actual menu, there's also ziosks where you can order food and drinks right from the table. But it's more convenient if you're paying with debit/credit card and be sure that the server activates it for you first.  Our drinks and appetizer of Onion rings came out quickly, but we waited again even longer for our burgers. I went with one of the new items, the Southern Charm Burger, consisting of a 1/2 lb Angus beef patty covered with melted cheddar cheese topped with applewood bacon and sautéed onions doused in barbecue sauce on a ciabatta bun. Also came with their signature bottomless steak fries. Though it sounds and looked delicious on the menu, the burger wasn't anything too special. I waited sooo long for my food, I devoured it outta pure hunger and impatience, which didn't sit too well with my stomach later.  I used to like Red Robin. But after experiencing the poor organization/service and mediocre food, the word YUMMM no longer rings true for me!!!

If you don't  mind being ignored  when you walk in , given dirty silverware, waiting forever to be waited on and given food prepared not the way you wanted it and served cold.This is the place for  you. Ordered  tortilla soup that had no tortilla strips. Soup wasn't  even hot when I got it mention that my soup didn't  have the totilla strips to server she said she would bring some 7 minutes  later she brings  them to me at this point soup was cold .  Service only started picking up when my mother in law said I should ask for a new soup. At this point I was so done with the whole thing that I made the comment, "It's  not my tip I just want to leave." Then all of the sudden  our server became very attentive. Go figure.  Needless  to say this is not the first time we received  horrible service  here. One time we went in @11am  when they first  opened and nobody was in there, our server was more interested  in chatting  with the other employees  then helping us. She seem as if she preferred  us to use the table pads to order our food then do her job. Brought our drinks but didn't  bother to check if we wanted  refills  until we finished  our meal. From now on will only go to the Red Robin in mall the services in my opinion is far better.

This place is decidedly average.  The Black & Blue burger with mushrooms and blue cheese is original and tasty.  The Irish milkshake, a brown cow made with Guinness Stout, is delicious.  The service took a while longer than desired on a busy night and the server was running around like a headless chicken, so even though he was very friendly under pressure, he was so frazzled it was unpleasant.  I might come back when it's less busy if I don't have anything to cook at home and i don't want to go grocery shopping; otherwise I can make equally tasty food at home, and clean the dishes, in less time then it takes to get served here.

HUGE hype over the burgers which are way overpriced!  For 11 bucks I expect the damn burger to melt itself in your mouth.  This one was more or less a fatter mcd's patty.  Yeah no, no way. Do yourself a favour and go to BJ's for a burger.  Bigger, better, and cheaper! The service here is OK and I like their little gadget of "calling your server" via an ipad on a stand looking thing but they ignore the blaring red light so what's the point?  They probably see it all the time and know to ignore it...?  I have no idea. In any case, it is the last time I'm going there.  If I wanted a watered down drink and overpriced burger because hell, I just won the lotto, I'll go here again... but yeah, no... you'll find me somewhere else eating a burger...and I'll make my own watered down drink, thank you!  Save myself the 7 bucks for said drink too!

We went to Red Robin Vacaville location for the first time, to have a burger. Was happy to see they have a Red Robin!  The burger was okay. Over done and a lot of mushy onions. It was still tasty, plus service was good... so 3 stars.  The surprising part about the place was how unclean it was and it was only noon on New Years Day.  There was mashed food and wooden skewer next to our booth on the floor. Service people walking over it back and forth.  The wood wall dividers dusty and pieces of debris. The drink menu had spatter and was sticky.  Didn't order a drink. The Ladies bathroom was disgusting.  Stuff on the tile walls, dirty floors, and 3 empty TP rolls and none attached in the holder (the most sanitary way) in the handicap stall.  The other stalls had no TP. The paper towel waste bin was overflowing onto the floor. The thing is... that this did not happen all in the morning and it was not that busy yet.  It has to be an ongoing period of neglect.  It is a turn off and what about food drink prep and kitchen conditions and regulations?  It can't be good. We have experienced unsanitary conditions in two other restaurants over the years in shopping trips to Vacaville... not sure what the deal is? I hope they can clean it up as I really like the chain for 'a chain.' Just trying to make you guys aware so you can improve things.

I have always been a fan of Red Robin, but the food at this location was mediocre. On a late Tuesday night with not many people in the restaurant, I don't know how you have to wait nearly 20 minutes for french fries. The burgers were ok, but not as good as other locations. Our server did everything in her ability to keep us happy, but I wish I just went to Jack in the Box and saved some money.
Serving burnt fries is a no no. This place doesn't care about it customers. Go to RR Fairfield for better service. This is the second time we haven't been happy here.  I doubt we'll be coming back.
Horrible service ... No one check on us and we had to request everything. I won't be coming back here

I used to loooove going to this red robin this place has gone very downhill right after they remodeled it.  The 3 times I've been to this red robin in the past few months the service has been really slow, the food has been cooled down like it was just sitting back there for a while and every time I would ask for campfire sauce I would always have to ask more than once but they would remember my wife's ranch every time.  Until I hear from someone else that the quality has gone back up I will not be coming back (which is unlikely because everyone I know that used to love red robin have also stopped going for the same reasons)

Our extended family tonight celebrated my nieces B-Day at the Vacaville Red Robin. All 18 of us live in Fairfield, but our FF Red Robin.....uh....lets just say NONE of us prefer it! . For such a big party the service was excellent! (Except 5 of our meals came out 10 minutes after first group), but Michaela and her partner (didn't get her name but my wife said she was amazing!) did an outstanding job!  My Avocado chicken salad was very tasty, and Michaela kept us "water drinkers" full all night long!  We Will be back!

It took almost 40 minutes for a cold BLTA sandwich and fries. Then when we complain the server got an attitude. Manager comes and apologizes and comps our food. Then not even 5 min later my friend finds a pube in her sandwich! The manager apologizes again but doesn't seem surprised... Hmm I will never go to this red robin again! Btw did I mention we were there an hour before they closed and the place was entirely empty. Not sure why it took 40 min for our food...

Deserves 0 stars! Gross and filthy with lazy ass employees! Very disappointing! How can a restaurant be kept so dirty and allow employees to be so lazy standing around talking amongst themselves while customers are waiting for service! Will never go to this location again!

Definitely a GREAT place for burgers - their menu consists of 90% burgers.  Having other variety of beef (e.g., buffalo, ostrich, etc.) would be nice addition to the menu. However, since this place specializes in burgers, prices are not on the fast food price so don't be surprised.  You go here for a meal and not a snack.

I'm kinda sad that I'm writing this review because usually I really like this place.  I ordered a to go order over the phone. They had the food all ready for me by the time I got there (15 mins later).  So first, they skimped me on my fries. Literally 6 fries in that box. ...what? Second, my burger was dryyyyy. I ordered the whiskey river bbq burger which should be the OPPOSITE of dry. I ordered it medium rare and of course they made it well done. They also put almost NO bbq sauce in there. So that combined with fried onions and the bread just made it feel like a desert in my mouth.  The up is the salted caramel milkshake. YUM.
This place is awful. The food is not good at all. The waitress is not experienced, very forgetful. Don't waste your time.

I usually love red robin, but the food and service were horrible. So bad that I might never eat at a red robin again. The garlic fries were cold and just covered in powder. The burger was dry w crazy too much sauce. Never not liked red robin before. Should have gone next door to BJs
Worst service ever...ran in to get a lunch and drink. Got out on 35 min i didn't want to wait anymore and to top it off everything was wrong.. in the end all they said was sorry... terrible service.

Never ever again!! Worst service and food was nasty!!  This particular Red Robin really sucks, the one in fairfield at the mall is fine. I went here with my kids today for lunch, they were not busy. We waited at the front to be seated for about 5 or so min.  Someone finally came to our table to get our order, but before she does I hear her talking to the manager saying she didn't want another table (real professional right?) anyway, she says "oh, I'm sorry my love!" .. That right there hella irritated me, I ain't your love, wtf? So we ordered, food came order was wrong, blah blah my food was disgusting so I sent it back, I didn't want anything else. The manager said sorry, and I just wanted my check. Well I waiting 10 min for them to bring me the dang check, no one ever came back to my table so I just left $10 (noodles my daughter ordered) and that was that. I probably could have just left.. I should have just left. Wack ass restaurant ..

I really like red robin in general but this location's service is pretty darn slow from the moment it opened. I have yet to come in (out of my 10 visits) and get fast service. It takes at least an hour and 20 to get in and out. BUT the burgers are pretty stinking good. If you have time this place is great. Love the bottomless fries and love how nice the servers are. They always try to make things right even when they are slow. It's not usually servers fault for the slowness.

Maybe it's Vacaville but many of the restaurants out here are sub par. I wish I could rate Red Robin with a negative 3. I ordered the seafood splatter and that's exactly what I got after eating here. The seafood splatters! On the menu it shows a huge plate of fish, shrimp and clam strips. When you get it, it looks like a kids meal. The food was cold as well. The hostess was a dingaling. There's nobody in the place and she tried sitting us in the smallest table I've ever seen. Wrong. Then my girl gets her soda and it's all carbonated water. Her food was microwaved and rubbery! Oh yeah and those food ordering kiosk devices they put on each table are neither clever or high tech. They are tacky and lame.
