If I have to order my food through that, you can forget about your $2 tip.

Ill start off by saying do not go here if you do not want your night ruined by horrible food and rude service. We were a party of 14 plus a baby. Most of the people at the table could have cared less if they had good food or not which is sad. But for some of us at the table who are foodies and want and expect good from red robins this place was a disgrace to red robins name. The frys came out stone cold and had that nasty seasoning on it which we asked them not to put it on them. My burger was flatter then McDonalds and it looked like it was ran over a million times and it was burnt. I had them take it back because it was so nasty. And i did not order anything else. When we asked why the soup and chili was not at our table yet the server replied saying " Well i cant touch the food until its on tray" ( at that point everyone was done eating and that person had not received there food) she then came back with refills before his food. When we asked why the burgers cant be cooked with some pink left she replied with " its because we dont cook steak. " i know you dont cook steaks i dont go to red robin for the steaks. Duhhh. Very rude waitress. I them went over what happened with both of the managers and they did comp us for what happened, but i will never go back. And shouldve known not to go somewhere that has that little of stars. DO NOT GO HERE. rant over. If i could give -5 stars i could.

Slowest service ever. Asked for fries for my son who has Down Syndrome (while we wait) and was told no because the "kitchen" doesn't have time.  We've been here going on 40 minutes and still haven't got our order. Should have went somewhere else! No manager even in sight.

I won't be back.. This is the second time I've been and the is just not right!!I love Red Robin but the one in Vacaville is going under.. Bad service and food.. I got BLTA with Tortilla soup.. My soup was cold and they but seasoned salt on my sandwich..It was so salty I couldn't eat it. Don't waste your time and money at this location. The management and staff  don't take pride in their work..
I love their fish and chips, but that stupid electronic thing they've got on the table is an eyesore. It was a neat concept, but please make it go away now.

A month ago we had a bad experience here. We decided to try again tonight. It was relatively busy but we were seated immediately. Our service tonight was excellent; drinks and food orders were correct and delivered promptly, refills were constant and our server, Veronica, was pleasant and engaging. Kudos to management and the floor team for working towards improvement.

Not sure about the negative reviews, but came here today with my girlfriend and we had an enjoyable experience. The server we had was very nice and the food was great! I ate a Royal Red Robin Burger and it was great. We both shared an appetizers of onion rings that were fresh and hot. I liked the device they had at the table that allows you to order more drink and even pay when you're ready to go. Regardless of the device our server still came by to make sure we were good! I will definitely come back again sometime when I'm feeling for a good burger.

We've been here a few times and have had decent experiences. But, tonight was awful. The wait was about 20 minutes, but the place wasn't full. We were able to put in our order fairly quickly after sitting down.  But, then it went downhill from there.  Almost 40 minutes for our food to arrive. Server only came by once after our drinks were delivered to ask if we needed anything during which we asked for some fries to hold us over until the food came.  Never got refills on our drinks until we asked.  Food was okay...we had the black & bleu burger, tavern burger (eh) and kid's cheeseburger. They've gotten skimpy on the bottomless fries. We had to wait long times for the refills to come and when they did it was not a good serving.  So......I'm sad about this review because generally I like Red Robin, but this location is not one of the better one.s

***Do not visit this Red Robin...drive to Fairfield, trust me it's not worth going to this one*** So first off my poor review here stems from months ago. I have eaten at this chain multiple times, every time has been a poor experience. However, I understand that not all chains are perfect and there is always room for growth. The worst part of this chain is the excruciatingly slow service. I went in for lunch with my wife and son at 1:15pm on 5/15. It was not busy, most of the tables were empty with only 3 other parties seated. We got our menus and ordered from our server promptly after being seated. This was around 1:20pm. We ordered the zucchini sticks and jalapeño coin appetizer, 2 burgers, and a kids grilled chicken. We got our drinks shortly after, and this where the pain just dragged out. It was 1:40 and we still hadn't received our appetizers. Last time I checked, zucchini sticks and jalapeño coins do not take 20 minutes to cook. Upon receiving our app (from a different person by the way) I asked how long it would take for our burgers. The server said she'd check....never saw her again. 15 minutes pass and I finally catch our original server. I asked her to check on our food, and she came back with our food.  All good right?  Nope.  Instead what we got was one of the burgers cold and the grilled chicken wasn't cooked all the way. They served pink chicken to our 2 year old son. So at this point it's nearly 2pm when we get our food, roughly 40 minutes after ordering. I called the server to bring the manager out. Who we got was a manager on duty (not the general manager) who had just transferred in.  I explained that i had some major concerns with the wait time and showed him the pink chicken meat. At this point I didn't even bring up the cold burger, we were just hungry. He proceeded to tell me that one of the burgers can take up to 20 minutes to cook. Which is fine and all if it is what it is, but keep in mind we ordered 40 minutes prior and our apps alone took 20 minutes to cook. He took the kids meal back and removed the cost from our check. Meanwhile our son is still hungry because we didn't let him eat the undercooked chicken. Before we left, I talked to the manager on duty again and explained that this wasn't the first time I have had issues at this specific Red Robin. I'm even a regular at the chain he used to work at in Concord, which I have had no issues with. I told him he had his work cut out for him because this location has major issues, paid our bill, and left with out still hungry 2 year old son who wanted grilled chicken. -Extremely slow service on multiple visits -Cold Food -Undercooked Chicken Never again.  If you are considering going here, please just drive to Fairfield or another place to eat. Otherwise you'll be waiting for cold undercooked food.

Don't go here. The service is mediocre, the food is cold and justin the manager does not know what he's doing. He was extremely rude and not willing to even discount a meal because of a horrible experience. He looks at you with a cocky smirk as though you are insignificant and not worth his time. Seats are too close to other parties and they cram you in. I have been going to Red Robin for 20 plus years and have never had an experience like the one I had tonight at this location. There is some much needed training here unfortunately.

Great burgers,  service is decent.   I'm a fan of this franchise so what can i say.   But being a burger enthusiast I can say that their burgers are better than most burgers at fancier places.   Endless fries,  ice cream shakes,  and drinks are nice.   But remember,  this is a burger joint so don't be surprised when your mac and cheese isn't good while everyone else is enjoying their tasty burgers.

The best salad! Fresh variety of lettuce, tasty BBQ chicken,half Avocado,one boiled egg,many bacon, some tomatoes,and bleu cheese! So good! The whiskey burger also taste very good ! Especially the fries! They bring all the French fries you want! And it's fresh and hot,I am not fries person but I like their fries.

Caught Game 1 of the NBA Finals at Red Robin. Sat in the bar area, with good views of two TV screens, and ordered through the waitress, not the electronic tablet gadget thing. Started with one of the $5 appetizers, one of my weaknesses, the salted pretzel bites with cheese sauce. These came out good and hot, soft and not overdone. Beers came out fine, I also tried both the peach and raspberry flavored iced teas -- too sweet and artificial, but if I had to choose one over the other I'd go with the peach. Main orders were the Bacon Cheeseburger ($10.49) with cheddar cheese, some pink, and the garlic herbed steak fries ($0.99 extra), and the Black & Bleu burger ($14.29) off the "Finest" menu, some pink, with sweet potato fries ($1.49 extra). For dessert we tried the short (4 instead of 8) tower of Doh! Rings ($5.99) -- basically RR's version of cronuts, which came with a fudge sauce and a berry sauce to dip them in.  The bacon on my burger wasn't crispy or anything, and the herbed streak fries look like they were just seasoned with garlic salt with some chopped parsley; I was expecting real garlic. This part of my meal wasn't that spectacular. My bf had the Black & Bleu burger, which comes with blackened sauteed portobellos, caramelized onion, bleu cheese sauce/crumble and dijon on ciabatta. The sweet potato fries are also cut skinny; why can' they make sweet potato steak fries too? In my opinion, for a bleu cheese fix, save your $3.50 and just get the Bleu Ribbon burger ($10.79) off the "Gourmet" menu. That comes with steak sauce, chipotle aioli, bleu cheese and onion straws on an onion bun. As for the "bottomless" fries aspect, neither of us ordered regular steak fries to begin with, but the second basket they brought to our table was just the ordinary seasoned steak fries. Oh well. The refill on beer took awhile too. The dessert was an afterthought, but since it was close enough to National Donut Day and cronuts are the "in" thing we got a half order to share. The presentation reminds me of a paper towel dispenser. The plastic cups with the sauce were not wide enough to really dip the donuts in easily. I did prefer the berry sauce over the chocolate. Covered in sugar, they did have some of the layering inside like a croissant and were okay. I've had other cronuts, as well as funnel sticks, donuts, etc. with the same idea before.  Service overall was okay. Bathroom floors were a litle sticky but otherwise well-stocked/maintained. Parking can be difficult since the lot is shared with BJ's and the Golden 1, otherwise easy to get back on I-80.

This red robin location seems never to have their act together. The service is almost nonexistent. This was our second time at this location and it was as bad as the first time.  My grandson had his heart set on a corn dog. When we ordered it the waitress told us they wouldn't have them until tomorrow. It took 9 minutes for our drinks to be delivered and one of the appetizers we ordered was not brought at all. When we paid we tried to use a coupon and no one could figure out how to apply it. The manager came out and only spoke to the wait staff and not to us. Customer service?  Forget about it.  There are many places to get a good burger so we will avail ourselves to those places in the future.

The food is very average and so is the service. I mean I didn't expect much from the restaurant anyways. Giving them 3 stars because the bottomless fries and a plus. Don't get the bottomless root beer float. They don't refill it enough so it's not worth it at the end of the day.

Thie manager just said the soup & salads had just changed  two weeks ago and couldn't accommodate my request in vacaville location. Since I chose this for my family dinner, won't be coming back. customer isn't able to get their order- Really?

I always love coming here. Their burgers are amazing. I got the bleu burger and added mushrooms with rye bread. We also ordered pretzels with cheese and the cheese was really gross. We were really disappointed with that...but the burgers and fries are amazing. So is the sparkled lemonade!

We Planned On Going To BJs Brewhouse For Lunch And They Had  A 30 Min Wait Time. So We Walked Over To Red Robin Since It Wasn't Overly Busy. We Sat In The Bar Area, It Was Nice Inside And Our Server Was Polite. We Ordered The Pretzel Bites, Wings, Balsamic Salad, And Two Burgers. The Appetizers Came Out: Pretzels Bites Were Over Cooked And Cheese Sauce Tasted Rancid It Had Chunks Of What Looked To Be Lettuce Or Petrified Onions And Tasted Horrible I Asked For A Side Of Ranch For Dip But By The Time It Came The Bites Were Hard And Cold. The Wings Were Decent, Hot And Sauce Was Good No Complaints But By No Means Memorable. The Salad: Great Looking Lettuce, Croutons Were Delicious, Cucumber Slices Were Crispy But The Dressing Tasted No Where Near Like Balsamic Vinaigrette... Maybe A Low Quality Store Bought Italian. The "Gourmet Burgers" Were More Like 9 Month Old Frozen Patties They Had No Flavor, Not Even A Hint Of Seasoning. One Bite And I Was Reaching For A Napkin To Spit It Out. My Fiancés Burger Was Burnt To A Crisp When He Asked For Medium Well. I Had Asked For Well Done And Mine Was No Where Near As Black As His. I Would Love To Know Where The Owners Of This Place Get The Nerve To Even Place "Gourmet Burgers" In Their Company Name. I Make Better Burgers At Home. Cheap Meat? No Seasoning? Lack Of Experience In The Kitchen? This Place Needs A Serious Reality Check The Quality Of Food. Next Time I Would Definitely Wait The :30 Mins For Somewhere Else. The Manager Did Comp All Our Food, We Paid For Drinks, Salad And Wings. They Admitted Their Mistakes And Made Things Right But I Will Never Be Back Or Recommend The Food To Anyone I Know. Sorry.

We went to the Vacaville Ca Red Robin  restaurant had family with us that was traveling from outside the country with a Valid Passport and we were trying to order alcohol beverage and they would not accept it  that was so upsetting

very disappointed at this particular location. very slow service and server got multiple orders wrong with no apology or offer of a complimentary appetizer. waited almost an hour for our meals and got our drink orders wrong, twice. horrible experience and will not be returning.

food was good.  but service was really slow.  45 minutes from taking our drink order to getting our food.   Server was not attentive, kept having to flag her down and ask for things....like silverware, drink refills etc.

I love Red Robin and was excited to bring my kids here as it was definitely my favorite burger chain as a kid and we don't have them near where I live now.  The food was good and I liked the new burger options.   Unfortunately the service was sub-par.  Our server was apparently in training and, although she was nice, she didn't seem to understand that parents do the ordering, not small children.  As she was giving the run down on food, she was looking not at me but at my children, trying to entice my kids with appetizers, and asking them if they wanted any. Then she did the same with the upgrade options for for my sons sweet potato fries without mentioning that it cost extra (I learned this from our eventual bill).   When I gave the server a $3 coupon at the end, she came back with my new bill...but it wasn't even mine and it was $20 more, rather than $3 less than my bill.  Then they still wanted me to pay with their table top payment machine.  Their machine wouldn't  just accept my card until I swiped a loyalty card (which I don't have).  This all took a good 20 minutes.   Just not impressed
Yum they have great drinks and food! Can't go wrong with bottomless fries either. We enjoy having lunch dates here.

So I had previously given Red Robin 5 stars as every time I had gone I've had a good experience. Unfortunately today I called to place an order for pick up. I called multiple times as every time I called they ended up hanging up on me. When I finally got through, I had been on hold for 10+ mins. I placed an order for a simple burger and they said it would take 20 mins for it to be ready and it took like 30. I'm pretty bummed!

Our friends love to come here when they are in Vacaville so we decided on lunch here. It was noon on a Monday and it was pretty empty. We were promptly greeted and seated by a very friendly hostess.  Our server was by very quickly for our drink orders and to explain their kiosk appetizer ordering and check out functions.  We all decided on our meals and our order was taken. I ordered the bleu burger and my husband had the Royal burger and mine was made small size due to my small eating restrictions which was nice. All had the choice of onion rings, fries or sweet potato fries. We opted for fries with dipping sauce. Our friends had the classic burger and the bleu Niger too.  It did seem quite a long time for our order to come out but we weren't in any hurry.  My husbands burger had the sunny side up egg on it which was a miss, not runny as it should of been, yolk was hard. My burger didn't have any bleu cheese flavor at all which was really disappointing when that's the whole point of ordering a bleu burger. Fries were mediocre at best. Well I think the best part was our nice server and my tasty coke.

I come to this one often. I love the wraps and burgers. We came last week and our server was great. Her name was Stafanie. She was friendly kept our drinks full and checked on us just the right amount of time. Definitely will be back.

I ordered The Southern Charm Burger and my boyfriend ordered The Black & Bleu Burger. They were Hands Down the best burgers we've had!! Not to mention their Bottomless Fries are a plus!! They also have a Freckled Lemonade with real strawberries in it! "Yummm!!"

We went her for lunch because it was the best vegan burger option in town.  To keep it short, the presentation of the food was not that great and the burger was a disappointment. There was a tiny little bit of shredded lettuce inside, the opposite of their photos. The whole burger was dry and mediocre. The fries come in such a tiny bottomless bowl that their bottomless concept seems hokey. And that for $10 bucks, not including tip?? I make way better burgers with tons of lettuce, quality patty and quality bun for $4. No, that was the first and last time at Red Robin. The two star is for the fact that they offer a vegan burger option.

I do not understand all the poor reviews for this Red Robin.  I came in today with the Hubs around noon. We were greeted cheerfully and seated promptly. Our waitress, Megan, was awesome. She was on top of our needs without being "lurky or overbearing". Our food was out to us fast, and everything tasted fresh and delicious. I've been to the Red Robin in Solano Town Center mall, and it was worse than terrible. So I don't get why several reviewers say it is so much better than the Vacaville location.  I will be returning to this Red Robin again soon, and offer! UPDATE: I was in again with the Hubs and the Wee One this past weekend (12-5-15). We sat in the middle of a very busy dining room at 12:30, and had the same great service and food as our first visit. Bravo!
Horrible service, cold food, excuses for all of it... Not at all happy with our experience tonight.  It'll be a long time before returning

Since experiencing an outstanding Red Robin in Southern Oregon this location was a far fall. A positive though, the food was as tasty as each Red Robin location we had been too. My biggest concerns was with the staff and overall dining experience. From working in the restaurant industry the location was having a slower Friday but the staff seemed frantic and new. Our server was very polite but had made a few mistakes with in putting the order. Lastly, I'm from Oregon and i ordered an alcoholic drink and it took the staff 7 minutes to verify if my ID was valid. I completely understand the concern and security but i have traveled many different states and this was the longest verification processes I've been through. Overall I will not be returning to this location.

I also do not understand the negative reviews for this Red Robin. My husband and I eat in the bar so maybe the restaurant section has worse experiences? We both love the food and the service at this Red Robin. The service is always prompt, polite, courteous and friendly. I wish I  knew the names of the regular servers we have had so they can get the recognition. We always order the same meal - teriyaki chicken burger with the garlic herb fries. Delicious every time! ( I would give them 5 stars but they need to clean their restrooms a bit better.)
OMG here we sit for over an hour and a half for hot dogs, a hamburger and soup! What the heck- we had to ask the waitress for bottom less fries....what's up manager!!!

Not good the last 3 times we have come here service has been subpar and food has been over cooked and cold. We gave them 3 chances thinking it was an off night but all outcomes the same. We won't be coming back its no wonder the restaurant across from them always has a wait.
I'm only giving two stars for the drink I had. My burger was sent back a few times I order onion straws that was a oily mush. Next time I'll pass and just go somewhere else near by.

My son got mini corn dogs & I got the red robin burger.  My egg was WAY undercooked (I'm not super picky, but let's at least cook the whites of the egg people) & my sons corn dogs were burnt... :(. Won't bother stopping here again on my road trips. Should have gone to BJ's... *got my burger back with a rubber egg... Not worth complaining about at this point...*

Service took forever for TWO people, not even a big group. Serving size for our artichoke dip appetizer was so tiny - wasnt even enough for all the chips... My chicken platter was really average. Really bad experience!

A yelper makes reviews from an experience(s) they had right?! Well here is another for the record. On Saturday, December 4, the wifey and I decided it would be a nice little outing to head to the famous Red Robin. We were craving some good burgers. Unfortunately, our food adventure did not get that far. Upon entering through the two, double-door entryway, we were immediately in line. Not that there was many people. There were three to be exact and then another four that came in behind us. From the doorway to the front counter is about seven steps away, so not much room to congregate comfortably. To the left there is a red, cushioned bench to rest your wearing bones....from waiting for a RIDICULOUS amount of time!! That's right! The wife and I entered the restaurant and waited to be greeted. Yes, that is normal for any place you go to BUT we waited, along with the others, for more than the standard wait time. What is the standard wait time you may ask? I do not know but I am pretty sure you don't have to wait awkwardly for more than three minutes--to be noticed! Multiple waitress walked by all of us w/o any type of greeting, almost avoiding any eye contact. On Sunday, December 5, the wifey and I decided to try the eatery one more time...hoping for the best. Unfortunately, we were let down AGAIN!! The only difference, we did not stand around waiting as long as the first time, hoping to be noticed.   I just cannot figure out why no staff acknowledged our presence on BOTH days. Customer service was lacking significantly! I am sorry I cannot state anything about the food at this time. fin.

This resturant is horrible, do not eat here! I got a Cobb salad the lettuce was brown and rotting. Also, they completely left the avocado off. The chicken was a pressed chunks chicken not an actual chicken breast and the dressing was tasteless......our server was great, but obviously the manager needs to work on quality control.

Food is as expected for this chain. But what is with this Ziosk crap?! I'm having to do half of my server's job and you're going to assume a 20% tip?? These things take up extra space, are too tempting to be messed with by kids, and caused our sever to disappear for far too long without checking on us because they assumed we knew how to use this thing. Not to mention how hard it is to have to swipe my own card and balance this contraption while also balancing a busy baby on my lap. This is a waste and a lack of customer service. Get rid of them! I sure hope my hometown Red Robin hasn't adopted this garbage.
Overpriced !!! Cheap tasting foodpick something else. Typical chain type fare. Husband never ate here and wanted to try a burger !!! He was disappointed.

Expected a lot more from this location after passing it for the last couple of days while visiting up north. First, things looked good by being seated promptly and by a smiling hostess.  Then greeted by a polite server. However, problems arose when it took 15 minutes to put in our order, then another 30 minutes to wait for appetizers (a wedge salad that arrived as dessert), after an hour total our food finally arrived. Did I mention we weren't checked on regularly for refills and had to rely on the hostess who we tracked down to help?! As I sat there with my starving toddler on my lap I realized we made a HUGE mistake coming here for a quick family dinner....I refuse to eat again at this location and HIGHLY recommend no one else in the area or passing by does either!!!! Plus...we asked to speak to the manager to let them know about our dining experience and were never approached or met by the manager!!!! Awful...absolutely awful.

For some reason my first review was not showing. Management and ownership needs to know that this place is failing to deliver even a little good customer service which is sad because the food is good.
Not pleased with the service, management, and food. I am a huge RR fan and past longtime employee, but tonight's visit was not acceptable. I will still visit RR I the future, but just upset.

We had a really good family dinner at Red Robin the other night! They fit our large party in with no problem. The burgers were really good and so were our other meals. They are very kid friendly there too. But the best part of our visit was our server, Jessica. She is very professional and patient. She was on top of making sure our drinks were full and we had what we needed, even though we could see she was busy! Thank you Red Robin and Jessica! We will be back!
This restaurant is great. The food was awesome, the service was excellent, and the tablets on the table are great for  the kids to keep them quiet. Overall great experience will be back soon.

The service was slow and the place was messy. The bathroom were disgusting their stuff everywhere on the floor counters and no one was cleaning them. Which shows at hygiene is not a priority at the restaurant and I will not be returning back.

Good staff, haven't had anything negative to say about that expect I'd suggest Mr/Mrs Robin, Red  - find a room where they can hide the non essential employees instead of piling them up near the kitchen area to gossip and chill.  Just looks unprofessional.  Yes, it is important to at least appear like you enjoy the job.   I cannot stand the automated ordering system they stick on your table.  First time there I was never told that our kids could sit there and order game after game for a fee until it was too late.  When I inquired I was told "you'll have to take it up with the software company".  Really?  Second time we didn't skip and a beat and threw the thing under the table.

Their burgers are great. They have so much variety on their menu, although some are very pricey, that I can always find something I would like to eat.  However, my favorite burger is the one with bacon and an over-easy egg or the guacamole bacon burger. I sometimes find it hard to try something new because I love those 2 burgers so much.   I used to eat at the Red Robin in Concord (Sun Valley) all the time but their service has gotten so bad (slow food service) that I have banned returning to that Red Robin.  I've even noticed that there are hardly any customers there anymore but the wait for their food is still extremely long.  I much prefer this one in Vacaville for the great service.  There's always seating available, the servers are friendly and helpful AND most of all, the food arrives timely.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant for great food and good service.
This was a cool place to pop in and grab a burger what's a little bit of sports and head out back on the job
Food was pretty good, customer services was Ok, nothing special. Typical burger spot.

Deschutes, Lagunitas, and Racer 5 all on tap. We're off to a great start. This was a Friday night around 6pm. Not busy at all and ample bar seating available. Atmosphere is everything to me and the first thing I notice is all the overhead bar lighting was off. Asked about it and told a circuit blew. Second thing I noticed was how frigid cold it was?! Really? Had to stay bundled up the whole time. Asked to warm it up, but couldn't really tell. The one bonus about this place? NO KIDS PERMITTED IN THE BAR AREA! Thank you.  Since this was more of a appetizer and cocktails visit we started with pretzel bites and the mini tower onion rings. These were both fantastic; although the dippers that accompanied them could use a little work. Ranch dressing in a plastic cup just isn't winning me over.  We ordered the fish and chips entrée to share. The kitchen staff was kind enough to split and plate it separately for us. It was actually executed quite well. We opted for the free refill on fries as they were delish and also bottomless.  Mini towering doh rings. Again, the dough rings were perfect but the dippers need some work. They have a very pre made and artificial taste as though they came from a can or jar.  Surrounded by nice high def televisions at the bar.  Need a better variety of sports on the screens. I saw 6 around the bar all playing basketball (the same channel) at a time when NHL is mid season with tons of games and the PGA is in Pebble Beach. Get some variety up there please. It's been about a year since our last disappointment and things are noticeably  better. Staff was very friendly and food was better prepared. We shan't wait so long to revisit.

I came during lunch hours and the food was amazing!! The Service was great and didn't have to wait long for anything. Best burger of my life! I'll come again during busy, peak hours and see if the service is the same. I highly recommend this place. Had the royal red robin burger by the way.

Was about to dine here w my siblings. Bitch in the front desk, white short haired blonde bitch was rude as hell to my siblings and I. No thank you!!!!!! Have a great day at your "job" you shitty ass host! Hope red robin replaces you because of your shitty attitude. Get a job that makes you happy rather than...... Queen Felicia. Bye
Friendly and fast service.  Really on top of fry refills and beer refills.  We were there at an odd hour between lunch and dinner and felt completely welcome.

What a lousy experience!  I have food allergies, so we go to red robin frequently when traveling.  Tonight, our waitress didn't even offer us menus on her first pass.  It took nearly an hour to get food.  My burger was cold.  Like they stuck it in the  refrigerator cold.  Nasty.  The fries were not even that warm, so its not like they were waiting on those.  No one checked on us so I couldn't complain until I'd eaten the burger.  The manager came by to ask if I might want another burger...presumably warm this time, but I didn't really want to wait another hour.  No other offer.  Never again.
Two thumbs down. I don't blame the employees for the bad service. This place is poorly managed. Btw - they have a great outside patio but it's dirty and just a mess. I will never return.

This was the worse experience I've ever had Now I use to work in the restaurant industry, I actually even worked for this company some years ago. The values they use to have were amazing, now it seems as tho they could careless about their guest. I went out to eat with my 4 year old son, we stood at the host stand for about 10 minutes waiting for a host to come up. She finally came up and said she would need to clean off a table, no biggie I get it. Took another 10 minutes and we finally got sat. We eventually for greeted by a guy after sitting for 15 minutes, took our order . We got our drinks .. My son had to go to the bathroom .. At 4 year old he still requires my company. So we got up and walked to the restroom .. We were probably gone about 5 minutes and came back to our table bussed. I was upset about that but whatever, they got us our drinks again and our food finally arrived.. It tasted horrible but hey it's food. I let the waiter know i was upset that our table had gotten cleaned within 5 minutes of not being there and he replied "I figured you just left". Now a sorry would have been IMO a better thing to say, or to even possible have the manager stop by the table to check on things.  I use to love red robin, the food & atmosphere . But now it's going away from family restaurant to more of a bar and I personally don't like that. The service is terrible, the food is ok, unless Applebee's has a huge huge huge wait I won't ever be coming back to this red robin.

Solid burger place. And for me I'm not a huge burger person but I enjoyed this place and if I have a hankering for a burger and don't want to spend a lot of time waiting at in and out I'll most likely come back here. My boyfriend and I both ordered the whiskey river bbq burger his without mayo and tomato, mine with everything. It was a damn good burger. I like my meat bloody but if I'm eating a burger it has to be cooked all the way through. And they did that well without making it dry like other places. The mayo and BBQ sauce together mixed into a creamy goodness with the burger. And the sweet potato fries are amazing! They also brought out more fries before we were even done with our fries. The waitress was very attentive and it was pretty busy I was shocked at how great she was! All in all it was a great experience

I love Red Robin, and our food was delicious but for some reason, the BBQ dip that was brought to us had a slice of zucchini in it. We told the waiter, he brought another cup, which also had a zucchini in it. Then, we found a zucchini slice in the whiskey river BBQ wrap we ordered. Very bizarre, and slightly amusing!
Slow service...staff too busy talking amongst themselves than worry about their customers... Food, marginal.   Too many choices are in Vacaville to come back
The fries were extra hot and good.   The waitress was very nice and upbeat.    Hamburgers are okay.

I've reviewed this several times and it keeps getting deleted.                                                            Anyways this place is great fora lunch time burger. It's never packed and the servers are extremely friendly (even alittle over friendly at times) I order a different burger every time and it's always something I've never seen at any other establishment even the most diverse burger places out there.                                                          For it being a chain I'm still not a fan of the prices I would except the same price for a burger at a more upscale place.                                                    All and all if I'm craving a quick good burger this place is a go to.

Our fries were cold. No big deal, eat them and get more. New fries were somehow colder than the first.  Drink was watered down. No big deal, drink it and get another. Next drink was equally as watered down. Should've called it a freckled water, water with hints of strawberry.  We tried to avoid the Nut Tree Plaza parking lot and we definitely regretted that decision.

Food is great, prices are reasonable, the service sucks! We been here twice and each time the waiters were not attentive. The drinks are rarely refilled, you never have napkins and it takes forever for them to introduce themselves when you first get seated.  I tried this place twice and each time the service was horrible.

Went to Red Robin's last night because my daughter chose the restaurant.  We came in at the end of the rush.  The couple behind us was dealing with the manager.  The woman's food was wrong and the french fries were in a petrified state. We were advised our server was only the second day of this job.  Normally, not an issue.  However, if you're going to train new servers, teaching them to refill drinks and removing appetizer plates is part of the process.  In my opinion, having 20+ years in hospitality, she needed to be supervised more or limited on her tables until she wasn't as flustered. We placed our order and it literally took at least 45 minutes.  Our waitress avoided our table completely.  My husband requested to speak with the manager after we witnessed another table receive their food and they had been seated only 15 minutes prior to ordering.  Our waitress chose that time to let us know they were "putting our food together".  We pointed out the other table, seated after us (by about 30 minutes) was already eating but they were still "putting our together"?  She went back into the kitchen.   About five minutes later our food was brought out by the kitchen supervisor.  When I asked if he was the manager, which is whom we requested to speak with, he confirmed he was.  He wasn't.  He was a shift supervisor.  When asked why the other table only recently sat down and were already eating, while ours was just being delivered; he couldn't respond.  When I asked what the ticket time on our order was, he sputtered some "uhs" and said he didn't know, but it had been awhile.  He downplayed the entire issue and said, "well, you're food's here now".  Yea, because that makes it all better. Let's see, my daughter's order was wrong.  We had taken onions and mayo off her burger but it contained both.  My burger was warm but the extra-cost, sweet potato fries were lukewarm, at best and my husband's burger was cold. We sent it back, asking for our bill and the actual manager.  She took her sweet time coming to our table.  Since she came from the kitchen, it's likely she received a recounting of her supervisor's experience with us.  She came out, is an ultra quiet voice.  She wanted to make it "right".  However, it was 8:00 p.m., we still hadn't eaten and there was no way we were going to eat there.  When we pointed out the other table that received prompt service, she said, she was addressing our issue now.  She tried to tell me at Red Robin's "manager" and "shift supervisor" are interchangeable.  That simply is not true.  Managers are above a supervisor because they have more authority.  Obviously, by the could-care-less attitude from the kitchen supervisor, he clearly wasn't manager material. The manager, Rebecca, continued to talk in "soothing tones" like they teach you in nursing and psychology.   We asked for our bill and she said she'd take care of it.  She never let us finish a complete thought without interrupting and trying to keep the calm.  This irritated my husband to no end and he swore a couple times.  She had the nerve to tell him she'd have to ask him to leave if he continued that.  Seriously, we already told her we were leaving! We asked for her GSM's contact information.  She didn't know what a GSM (General Service Manager) was.  They had a regional manager, Brett, and she gave me his number.  I called and left a message as soon as we left, about 8:15 p.m.  The call was sent to voicemail.  I received a  call this morning from the same number, but it went to my voicemail (I was working).  There was no message left and when I returned the call, it went to voicemail again.  I have yet to hear from this Regional Manager. Overall, it was the worst experience we've ever had there.  They aren't stellar by any means, but this was absolutely ridiculous.  Customer service is a concept that is obviously foreign to that particular store.  The management is in desperate need of retraining.  When servers can be heard discussing why people are getting cut before them, and they've been there over 10 hours, it's not a good environment for anyone to be in. Save you're money...avoid this store.  Fuddruckers in Fairfield, CA is a better option and faster service! UPDATE (4/1/16):  It was nice of Red Robin to ignore the fact I asked to speak to someone above the Vacaville Regional Manager.  They were nice enough to email me, in attempts to not having to speak with me, to let me know they sent me a $20 gift card.  Awesome!  Yeah...no it's not.  I mentioned I would never be back but I wanted to speak with someone.  I called their corporate office again, requested my case be escalated, again, to have someone call me.  After all, last week I was promised someone from Red Robin would call me by Monday or Tuesday of this week.  That didn't happen either. ATTENTION RED ROBIN:  Have someone in your corporate office, look up case number 00699373, and have them call me.  Customer service means addressing the customer!

My wife and I have eaten at Red Robin Vacaville a few times including today at lunchtime.  We have always had good service and the food is good.  I was surprised to see its rating as two stars.  We live in Fairfield and have eaten at RR inFairfield more often but the service is not as good as Vacaville RR.  Today we were seated quickly the waitress was attentive a manager looking person came by each table to ask if everything was well.  So if service has been a problem it appears that the restaurant is working on it.  As for us the burgers are great and we like the sweet potato fries.  In my opinion, the smoke and pepper burger is the best.

Terrible sums our experience up. Cheap, previously frozen-not fresh food. Deep fried everything....seemed like they added extra oil when it was done.  The service was the only highlight. Our server was attentive and polite. But what was odd was he was pretty much forcing us to use the interactive menu thing on the table. He said "they would like us to use those as much as possible".....really? I could tell he hated asking people to use those, basically because it was impersonal and just weird. I mean I don't go to a hotel and check myself in at a kiosk. What bunch of marketing idiots at corporate decided that patrons would actually enjoy that? The server is there now let them do their damn job and get rid of those things! Anyways, will not be going back. I would go to Carl's Jr  instead.....same quality of food really but much cheaper. This place reminds of TGI Fridays but worse. Take the time and wait for a table at BJs.

I'm not sure how they served 2 burgers, 1 cold, 1 Luke warm.  The French fries are endless, but cold as well.  The restaurant is not even half full,  the service is like warm, like one of the burgers.  This is the second time in a row that the food has been a disappointment and this will be our  last visit here.  We should have gone to in and out burger.  The server had another burger made and it was perfect.  Corporate did reach out promptly and made things right
Pretty good food. Got the berserker burger and it was good. Our server was positive and very helpful. Did everything we asked for, I would come back and ask for Ashley.

We came to this restaurant for a celebratory lunch on behalf of a dear friend.  The bartender was great and promptly served us with 4 shots of Jack Daniels and our beer of choice.  I ordered the Royal red robin burger.  The dish was served with the egg sunny side up and was glorious. One of my favorite red robin establishments.

Sorry to say we went there tonight and we waited 45 minutes for our food and it was horrible overcooked burgers that were cold, and the fries were cold. The waitress forgot just about everything.  Will never go back.

The service here is deplorable. The only reason they received the 1 star is because the manager tried her best to pick up the slack. Aside from that it is severely under staffed , considering that it's grad season.

This place gives me mix emotions! The food is alright the waitresses are nice but the Bartender is very nice as well but she is so by the book on serving alcohol she will be the reason why NO one comes and this place gets shut down! I order a TNT witch is like a Long Island and it tastes like juice! When does a Long Island ever even come close too tasting like there is NO alcohol in it! Would love to come back when the bartender doesn't work there!

I've had really good burgers at other Red Robin locations but that was not the case this time... I tried the Royal Red Robin and it was pretty bland.  The fries lacked seasoning and the broccoli fills took quite a while to come out.  If you're going to advertise as a burger and fry joint, make sure those are on point!  Seems like kinks in the kitchen, not on behalf of the servers at all.  On the plus side, I tried a Sand In Your Shorts (PG version of Sex On The Beach?) and it was so good I almost got two!

Bryan was our waiter and he was really sweet!! My parents didn't get a chance to take the survey so I hope this still counts. We just stopped in coming back from the Oakland airport and were all really tired and hungry and Bryan took good care of us! :) It was his second day serving and he was really informative about the food because he had worked in the kitchen for a couple years prior. Thank you Bryan !

The service was horrible tonight.  After being seated, it took over 15 minutes to take our drink order. The food took over 30 minutes to receive with three different servers.  Drinks and fries were never refilled and we had to ask for our dinnerware. While paying for our bill (thru the kiosk because they never checked to see if there was anything else we would like to order), the waitress had the nerve to ask (more like beg) for a great review (she couldn't even look at us) and the rating survey kicked us out for taking too long. The only thing right was that our order was correct.

Waitress was nice. Manager was nice. Food was good.  My problem was the speed. It was sooooo slow. We waited and waited for our meals. Tables around us ordered and got their meals before us, and we were there way before them. Weird. Then, we ordered more fries. Never got them until after the meal was over. Just kind of expensive for very slow service.

The place smells like a school cafeteria, but our waitress (I think her name was Stephanie - short redhead) was really fantastic - she made our dining experience thoroughly worthwhile. She wasn't pushy to get us in and out of our table, helpful when we couldn't decide, and gave us room to breathe while stopping by to check on us at the perfect time. We would go back for her stellar service. :-)

Went to Red Robin on 8/9 and placed a to go order. I had to wait 40 minutes for my order and the only reason it was 40 minutes was because I asked someone to check on the order. The service is horrible. Food was luke warm. I could understand if the place was busy but their was only 3 people in the restaurant beside myself. After asking for a manager, a line cook came out and spoke with me, and that took another 5 minutes. he had the gall to tell be it was very busy! I hate to see what would happed if it was a crowded night.   We hadn't been to this Red Robin in over a year due to the service when at the restaurant but thought I would give it another try. Well I'm done giving this a try.  I even called a Manager today, and he just said he was sorry and thank you for the call, and hung up!

Walked in today at 3pm bc I I was on a long drive and thought I could use a good teriyaki burger real quick. Sat myself at the bar after being greeted at the door w the menu. Almost 10 minutes goes by and I've been ready to order. Must have seen 7 different employees and a manager walk by me without a single acknowledgement. Not to mention a bartender nowhere in sight. It seemed like a self serve bar to be honest. I wasn't sure how the other patrons had food and drinks. Also noticed an employee obviously on their break...grubbing down on a teriyaki burger I'm sure. Walked out. Never again.

Service is always SLOW. We like their burgers but the service is ALWAYS so SLOW we will only eat here about once every two years. Upon being seated today our waiter announced to us that he wasn't very busy. It then makes no sense why he would disappear for 10+ minutes at a time. We had to wait a very long time to get our fries, drink refills, etc. Bottomless fries are a joke here. Immediately upon being seated we asked for fries. It took about 15-20 minutes before our fries arrived at our table. They were not fresh, hot fries either. They brought out 2 baskets containing a total of 10 fries for a table of four people. Before our burgers arrived we asked for more fries. They didn't arrive until after we were half way done with our burgers. Pathetic! There are always several employees standing around as if they have nothing to do so it makes absolutely no sense why the service is always so bad.

Yikes!! Man oh man where to start, I won't put our waitress name on blast as I believed the manager was dealing with her already  and not sure if last night was her first night or what was going on but last night with the staff but man! I'll be hear forever explaining what happened but to sum it up, unacceptable wait time, food being delivered at different times with HUGE gaps in between plates, as in people were finishing while others still waited, people meals coming out missing several items, waitress being completely clueless and forgetting several items after we politely reminded her several times. Two stars is only for the manger who was very apologetic and did his best to remedy the situation. But to the waitress girl I understand nights can get stressful and maybe you were overwhelmed, hopefully last night was a learning experience so you can nail it next time and make more tips... good luck!

Piss poor service on a not busy day Plenty of employees standing around talking and not working No refill  Cold fries that came way to late Even worse burger that was not worth anywhere near what I paid for it Would have rather gotten a frozen microwave meal. No thanks won't ever come back. Stop hiring teenagers, or at least make them do their job. Gentleman two tables over was being completely ignored, he had his waiter walk right him looking the other direction, he had to then get up and walk over to him to ask for his drink. Pathetic.
Worst customer service I've ever had. Got 3 orders wrong, and had an attitude about fixing the orders won't be coming back.

My self and a group of girlfriends came here on a Friday night about 9:30. Got seated right away and ordered drinks. My bar drink came first before my friends water did. Hmmm. Ordered 3 appetizers one of them being the chili cheese fries, the fries tasted like they had been sitting around for a while and a chili looked like it had just been thrown on top. Kind of a sloppy microwave disaster. My friend told our waitress (who was very nice) that she did not like them and she told the manager Juan. He looked at our table and gave us a rude face, didn't apologize or come over to our table to ask if there was anything that he could do. Poor management. We wouldn't be coming back to this establishment late at night again.

We originally went to BJs to find a twenty minute wait at 5PM on Sunday and chose to wander over to Red Robin. We were seated right away and put an order in for my 16 month old twins. We got our drinks ordered and our food and were waiting for our kids meals. Our waitress, Rosie, apologized profusely for how long it was taking and informed her manager with how unsatisfied SHE was with the length of time it took. Their food came out and ours shortly after. The manager, Courtney, came over and apologized again, comping our kids meals. We were quite surprised but pleased that the staff took the initiative to right the wrong before we brought up the issue. We will definitely be returning for the great food and hospitality that was shown tonight.

The food was at best 3 1/2. Service a definite 1 1/2 . Our waitress decided she was going to cut down one of the guests beers. He had 2 talls & ordered a 3rd, telling him that because we were getting close to leaving he didn't need a large n brought him a small. Mind you, he wasn't even driving! Sad

sadly most won't see this review.  Yelp usually (even my good reviews) hides them in not recommended section. I am inspired to write this review after I saw another bad review on the Vacaville crime alert FB.  This place is a crime.  Over past year gone down hill.  Servers rude and evasive.  Food often cold and slow to come from kitchen.  It is a management issue.  Employees not happy, kitchen slow and food poorly prepared.  And  dirty  dirty,,,  I was last there on 10-31-16 and did let them know I would not be back util under new management.   ps:  If you actually want guac on your guac/bacon burger; go to Carl's
Love this place. Food is great so are the employees. I just wish the restrooms were a little cleaner

Love the Robin! Location was by the Vacaville outlets and we went around 2pm. It was very quiet and we were seated immediately by a very nice waitress. We ordered the cod fish fried sandwich and the whiskey river BBQ on a chibatta roll. We also ordered the onion rings. We were very pleased with the quality and quantity of food as well with the service. You receive bottomless fries with your orders and the onion rings were flavorful and crispy. This place is a strong 4+. Give them a shot - you shouldn't be disappointed. They have a large menu and I know from other locations in different states - their desserts and drinks are off the charts Good job.
Very delicious and for a good price. We tried the artichoke dip for an appetizer, the Billion dollar burger and the Buzz mac&cheese bruger. Yum!!
The food was excellent and the service was as well. The GM was very esant and checked in with her customers

Went here for lunch with a couple coworkers. We all ordered burgers in with the expectation for bottomless fries. The amount of fries that come with the mediocre burger is embarrassing. We asked the bartender for more fries and by the time they arrived (20 minutes later)we were done with our meals.

Went here for the first time last Friday and I wasn't disappointed. We had a new server and she was great, very attentive, while I do agree they have gotten a bit skimpy with their fries, at least they are bottomless. I imagine they are that way now because people have wasted so much food. All in all I was satisfied with the service and food, we were sat as soon as we walked in and greeted by our server in a timely manner, we had to wait for one person in our party and while we waited she brought our drinks and continued to check on us - so I decided to just go ahead and get some fries while we wait and she brought them in no time. I'd come back to this location, in fact I want to come back to get my free birthday burger.

If you think good service is talking with your fellow employees and completely ignoring your customers then you will enjoy this place, this place just sucks more often than not the food is terrible. I can deal with ok service if the food is good but it honestly is horrible here, unfortunately my daughter loves there corndogs and milkshakes... after 2 months of not stepping in this place, I go in to a dead restaurant and ask for a booth, she goes and looks and as she is coming back to seat us her friends walk in, and she decided its a good time to catch up, while me and my family sit waiting to be seated. Im talking hugs for 4 people, laughing as if we did not exist, insane...anther time we had a waiter bring us food with cut up fingers, I actually had to tell someone as if Im the crazy one??? would you like any blood and scab with your dinner???.. but he did put on some finger gloves after but damn where is the common sense,  this place is just terrible.
Tuesday afternoon, came to have lunch, been here for 45 min already and still no food.  No mention from our waitress how much longer it will take, really slow service.

I used to LOVE Red Robin. Not any more. We got McDonald's hamburgers at Nordstrom prices. If you order from the "pub" menu, save your money and go directly to a cheap drive-thru. The Bottomless fry recipe has changed. Now it's the cheap, hard, low quality fake French fries. We ordered 2 Red Robin burgers and two pub menu burgers, We could barely tell them apart. The meat tasted like the fake "pink-stuff" burgers one would get at a cheap restaurant. All were cold and soggy. The buns were cheaper, too. The service was terrible, with a long wait for a table and service during the meal. Don't try the milkshakes. They're so small, but served in a glass that gives the illusion of being large. All of this for the $80.00 !!!! Go to McDonald's or Wendys. At least you'll get what you pay for. This used to be the best place for burgers, but now it's one of the worst.

Although the service was good the food quality was awful.  We ordered a beef Burger, wedgie style (wrapped in lettuce) and a Simply chicken wedgie style. The Beef buger was ordered well done. It arrived very under cooked and pink. It would have been perfect had we ordered a burger cooked medium.  The chicken pattie was not just fake tasting, it was also cold and under cooked.      Yuck!!  I've been here for beers several times and I may return for beer, but not for the food. It's too bad, it a nice place with poorly cooked food!

We came here for a nice lunch and ordered some burgers (totally forgot which ones exactly). We asked for both of them medium rare but they came out gray, dry, and tough. We asked a waitress (not ours, but we flagged her down for help) for another couple of burgers, but she curtly told us, "Sorry, we only do red and not red," which bothered us because, well, we asked for (in her words) red and got not red. Our own waitress then came to us and apologized, then took our burgers away so she could grab new ones from the kitchen. Then, the manager came out, apologized some more, and continually brought us fries until our burgers came back out (sweet!). When they finally came back they were juicy, as we had first asked for. Overall not the best experience, but the staff was mostly gracious and I love fries, so I'd probably come back here if I'm craving

We go there on a Wednesday night hoping that it wouldn't be too busy.  We actually were planning on going to BJs but with their wait being 45 minutes, we opted for RR instead.  We are seated and our waitress (Jess i think her name was) asks us how we are.  We say fine and my father in law jokes that he's miserable (he always does that), to which she replies something about every American being miserable right now.  Nice political dig.  Pretty ballsy assuming our political leanings, not to mention inappropriate.  At any rate, we shrug it off.  After ordering our drinks, the waitress returns with them and we place our order.  Husband orders a chicken sandwich without lettuce tomato or mayo.  About 10 minutes later, waitress comes back to check on our drinks and brings refills.  She spills my whole glass of iced tea on my 7 year old, and then brings us towels for us to clean up the mess.  She doesn't even help to clean it up.  So we do, and the towels and wet kids menu laid on the table through the WHOLE MEAL.  She did not pick them up.  Our food comes and my husband's food has lettuce, tomatoes and mayo on it.  He brings it to their attention and a short time she comes back stating that the food runner just grabbed the wrong one.  The scraped off mayo that remained on the plate indicated that it was the same order.  Whatever.  The food was good and then she presents us with the bill.  We tell her that we'll pay by one credit card and then she proceeds to show us how to process it ourselves on the tabletop machine.  Too much hassle for her to go run it apparently.  Husband reviewed the bill, pays it and we leave.  We  expected some type of discount for spilling a whole drink on our kid, maybe the spilled drink comped, maybe the kid's meal?  Nope, full price.  What makes it worse is that my 7 year old thinks it's his fault, saying "sorry mom, I should've packed extra clothes".   So to recap, here are the reasons I gave one star: 1.  Insulting political commentary 2.  spilled drink with barely an apology 3.  Made US clean up spill 4.  Did not remove towels from table 5.  Food order incorrect 6.  Same food order with scraped off items 7.  Made us process our own payment 8.  No comped drink for spill Sorry Red Robin, this was a complete fail on multiple levels.  We will not return.

Every time we come here, there are open tables available and the hostess tells us it is a 5 to 10 minute wait. It has to be because they are short staffed, but it is all the time! The only thing my son likes is the pizza and we were told the pizza oven wasn't working. This place is a disaster!
The service was lacking and gourmet burgers uuh definitely not a true favorful gourmet burger just an over priced average burger.

Came to have dinner tonight.. very disappointed the fries tasted like they'd been sitting around a whole..received less than stellar service tonight had to turn on the flashy light to ask for refills on drinks n fries.... got only one refill and the fries never came out! Got frustrated and left.. usually get great service here.... very disappointed

Absolutely the worst service!!! Ashley was our waitress tonight and she was the worst.  1. She argued with us regarding how we ordered our burgers (pink,no pink) 2. She took 25 minutes to bring out the condiments after we got our food. 3. We asked for refill of fries and got them 45 minutes later 4. We NEVER got water we asked for 5. My son asked for a refill on his chocolate milk and was told there wasn't refills on milk. We ask the manager to show us where it says that...it didnt! Then we ask to speak to the manager and he comes and apologizes for the service and we think great that was nice. He offers to take off the kids meal and one simple burger. We were fine with that....Then he goes on to say he will take care of dessert if we all want to get something. The bill comes out and he didn't waive anything. We ask the waitress to call the manager again...he comes out and says I didn't tell you I would take care of milkshakes. I said I would take care of dessert. Milkshakes aren't a dessert they can be eaten with a burger. WTF? Daniel was the MID manager we were dealing with and Ashley was our waitress!!!! They are a horrible representation for Red Robin. Go to another restraunt....save your time and money.

Service was poor. Food was poor. Received incorrect order. Ordered beers with our food that came after 15 minutes after our food showed up. Floors were disturbingly dirty and littered with food. The bottomless fries, etc weren't since no one showed up to fulfill any refills.

Here on a saturday and this place is blah. Bjs next door is packed. The employees here look trashy and dressed like slobs with colored hair and piercings. The food is also very sub standard. We had the chicken wings and they tasted freezer burned. This place will not last long. Thought id give them a try. Our bartender was nice though. Left food on the plate, would rather leave the place a little hungry and pay our bill and go eat at home.

Nothing special here!  I'm under impression that the only customers they get is because the BJ's Restaurant (1 minute walking distance) is too full and people lose patience in waiting.  Their bar area and appetizers are nice, but bar tends to get very loud as drunks know a good deal!

The Fry's tasted like they were reheated and lukewarm my chicken grilled sandwich tasted like it came out of the 7-Eleven with no flavor the chicken tasted like rubber. The server was very nice that was the only good part.

I love Red Robin and I love the mushroom and Swiss burger with endless steak fries! Mmmm ...this location was okay, not busy at all and service was okay...friendly but almost awkward. Cousin wanted to order the onion ring tower and the waitress said 'you could've ordered it from this' (ordering system on table)....um okay but we might as well just order at the same time as our burger. And had you told us when we arrived we would have... Burgers, fries and onion rings were yummy but sauces were brought in tiny plastic take out containers as they didn't have ramekins...odd and sure is difficult to dip those onion rings in those tiny containers...oh well we adjust well and go with the flow but I can see someone complaining.
Went and ate dinner here last night and had the Royale burger it was delicious my daughter had the pizza dinner was great service was excellent and I will definitely be going back again
My favorite spot in Vacaville. Great food, great service great times. If you're in the area stop in. You absolutely won't be dissapointed.

I absolutely love this place! They have such delicious burgers and can we talk about the endless fries?! Everyone is so nice and the service is amazing! Every single time I come in no matter who is taking care of us we always have a great time!
This is for the Red Robin in Vacaville...it's just not the same quality food has it used to be. Not to mention the cold fries we received were a HUGE disappointment!
COOL Radiohead's "Staircase" on their sound system. GREAT service from Farris and crew. FOOD is chain restaurant typical. DANG  I needed  a toothpick and there were none.
Service was okay but food horrible! Me and my husband were throwing up the night we ate there.

The waiter told us they didn't serve sweet tea, which one of us wanted. When he brought refills of tea, it was sweet tea, which the rest of us didn't want. One of the burger orders was wrong. He delivered a chicken sandwich and didn't offer to comp or replace it. Instead he commented that there was a lot of orders sitting, waiting to be delivered to customers and something must have been plated wrong. They are supposed to serve endless fries, but after our fries were eaten from our meals, the waiter was nowhere to be found. Also, the fries we were served were barely warm. Don't eat here.
We have been here a number of times. The service is always excellent!  Everyone here works so hard to make customers happy they deserve a much higher rating. Food is pretty good too.

This review is on the workers at the restaurant and RED ROBIN Corporate office and not the food. The food was excellent. I ACCIDENTALLY forgot my eye glasses that were on the table. I know, how dare i forget my eyeglasses!! When i realized my error and called back to the restaurant the person on the phone described them to me right down to the brand name and the case!  ALRIGHT, my glasses are still there! I was in a car accident and couldn't go back for them for 2 weeks. When I called the 2nd time I was told my case was missing but my eyeglasses were there right down to the name brand that they were. Well, thats something I think to myself. I am told that my eyeglasses will be kept in the mangers office for safe keeping. Thank you very much I say. When I go pick them up, to my dismay I find out that my eyeglasses are completely gone! Sorry! I called up corporate that same hour and I talk to Daisy who calls the restaurant and gets the same story I told. She says she cant think of any else but they were taken and will escalate this matter.  Give it 48 hours and someone will call me. No surprise no one calls. I call up today and talk to DEB in the corporate office.  I am upset about this and NONE OF THE INFORMATION I have given prior to daisy is on the system, EXCEPT a case number. DEB starts asking me for all this information I really didn't have at my fingertips. She says she will wait while I go find it. I say I dont have it readily available and it will take some time to find.   She presses me on the information while asking me to keep my tone in check. I tell her I am upset that NONE of the prior information is in the system and I feel like I have been taken for a SECOND RIDE. I say I need to hang up as I am getting really mad. DEB keeps saying Im trying to help but your being uncooperative in a very condescending tone  and finally I say  I will call her back as her condescending tone was getting on my last nerve.  And she doesn't want to let me off the phone but will if it makes me happy. I hang up! I go to breathe and take a few minutes before calling back and she calls me first. She tells me she called the restaurant and talked to the manager COURTNEY who claims I never left my glasses there, ever! Then DEB says, Sandy can I give you a few gentle suggestions about your glasses because you've lost them and you never left them at our restaurant.  I insist yes I did leave them there and it was verified twice that I did. I recanted the day and events that happened while I there the day, the time, the drunk woman at the bar bothering people that the bar tender finally cut off, and her husband being upset with her and blah blah blah. DEB state saying Sandy you lost your glasses somewhere else. You never had them in our store.  Here are a few GENTLE SUGGESTIONS for remembering where you keep things.  I told DEB if she said that to me one more time I was hanging up because I did leave them there and they were confirmed there and I don't appreciate this crap and she started again with her gentle suggestions and I hung up on her. I have called a different corporate number and will hope that I get some satisfaction from that call. BTW, the cost of the glasses was $35.00! Over the counter Foster Grants tri focal glasses. This is about the principal of the situation now. Not the cost. Will I ever go back to a Red Robin again...I think not!

I want to make sure our server Tony gets good credit because he was such a sweet guy and totally accommodating. However, the restaurant in general absolutely needs to figure it out. My Fiancé and I ordered simple appetizers. Specifically, we got the "voodoofries"... The cheese looked like it was under the heat lamp for at least 20 minutes. After our dinner I used the restroom which was completely dirty and 2/3 stalls didn't even have toilet paper. To top it all off, not a single person said goodbye to us. Probably because the host was charging her cell phone and checking her social media as guests were leaving. Not impressed Red Robin.

This is my first negative yelp review, so believe me I was pretty disappointed with my visit. After waiting about ten minutes a hostess sat us, then another ten plus minutes a server, whom was very friendly, took our order. Let me just say, wow they water down their drinks. I ordered a mojito and it tasted like water with lemon. Didn't taste any alcohol, and not because it was quality because there was little to none. Very disappointed in our visit tonight. Slow service. Watered down drinks. Below average food.

Service has seriously improved from the last time I came. Our waiter Lorena G did an amazing job waiting on me my husband and my 1year old . Super nice and patient with us. She refilled our drinks multiple times which I am grateful because we drink a lot of water . I hope Red Robin recognizes the waiter because it's people like her that make the company great ! Keep it up

Service was good but the food wasn't. My burger was burnt and all I tasted was burnt, dry meat. (Had ordered it medium well) the cookies and cream shake supposedly just had a little bit of chocolate in it but when I received it it just tasted like a basic chocolate shake.

I took my family out to eat on a Tuesday night at 8pm. Not a busy day in my opinion. The store had the two side dining areas cleaned and closed up with the chairs on the table. I understand pre closing so ok that's fine. In my head that means the store should be in pretty clean condition. It took a few min waiting till someone came up to seat us and the server came promptly. Justine S according to the receipt was friendly and nice. The kids were "starving" so I requested some of our fries ahead of time to appease them while the food cooked. I greatly appreciated that. The food wasn't anything special. My son loved his tavern burger but everything else wasn't anything well enough to give mention to. While taking my daughter to the restroom I was appalled by the state of the bathroom. Most of the stalls were out of things and the available toilet paper was just sitting around on whatever available surface. The toilet paper dispenser didn't even look like it could hold a roll. It was later in the evening and not busy so I'm not sure why the bathrooms were being ignored and in such condition. We promptly left and I don't know if I'll be returning anytime soon.

Terrible. This location and company as a whole has gone so far down hill. Everything we ordered was cold if not frozen. We left hungry, and seriously $40 for two very cold unedible meals? Never coming again. The server was really nice, but they need to hire "chefs" who know the difference between hot and cold. If you Yelp search any other Red Robin the reviews are the same with the same complaints.
Super slow to get our food! Took forever! Long Island iced tea was basically lemonade. Waste of $7.99!! Super small portions. We never got our "bottomless" fries... Not impressed with this place

Came in on a weeknight around 8pm. Our waiter was very friendly, however, he was covering about 8 tables by himself.  The service was very slow. There was plenty of other staff around and a manager but he was getting no assistance.  The food arrived after a longer than acceptable wait and all of our fries were cold.  The waiter never came back to ask how the food was... I wish he had because my ciabatta bun was smashed and stale.  By the time he came back, I returned the burger and didn't ask for a replacement.  Then, of course, we had to wait another 10 minutes for the bill to arrive.  Then of, course, then printer on their little wireless checkout machine wasn't working.  Also, don't order alcohol here. They skimp on the liquor.  This definitely the least positive experience I've had at any Red Robin.

I came in today around 3:30pm with my mother. She was in town from Oregon so I was treating her to dinner. The server was very patient with us as my mom took awhile to choose her meal. However, once we chose our meal we saw precious little of our server.  I initially ordered a coke and waited on my mom to order. The server came back and got my mom's drink order at which time I needed a refill which she tended to. Our meal arrived shortly thereafter. It was disturbing that our appetizer and main course arrived withing SECONDS of eachother. My coke was empty within 5-8 minutes of my meal arriving and I placed the glass at the edge of the table to indicate a refill. It went unfilled for over 10 minutes. Our bottomless fries were only refilled one time when the server happened to be walking by and ask if we wanted a refill and I had to point out my empty glass.  Once we reached a cessation of our meal the server came by. There was no offer of dessert or anything additional she was ready to check us out so we could leave. Grant it she helped me sign up for the rewards program and added a few points to my account once that was done I was left to pay my bill and there was no conclusion the waitress was done with us and we left. From here on I don't believe I'll ever dine in at this location but maybe just maybe order take out. I was extremely disappointed.

It's hard to mess up a burger, so getting 5 stars falls on the service and the value for what we spent and what we ate.  I paid $5 for a delicious wedge salad and $6.99 for a double tavern cheeseburger with endless fries. Everyone who approached us during lunch did it was a smile and I truly felt like my satisfaction was their priority.
terrible service. sat there for 15 minutes once seated. not even a drink order taken. finally got attention and sat another 10 minutes.

This review is for a visit on August 14th, but I forgot to post it until talking with someone last night.  My daughter and I went for lunch and it was not busy at all.  Despite this, we waited 25 minutes just for a waitress to take our order and then when she came and took our order, we waited another 30 minutes for our food. We only ordered a kids meal and a grilled cheese sandwich for myself and during this time the waitress never checked on us while we were waiting. When she brought our food my six-year-old daughter said "why did she only bring me eight french fries?" My plate also only had about six or seven french fries on it, however, when I looked at the table next to me, the waitress had brought out baskets of fries for them as well as for the table across from us. I asked for more french fries and the waitress took so long to bring them that we finished our entire meals and as soon as we finished, she brought out one little basket of fries. I have heard many negative views of this location and how they treat minorities and I hate to believe something like that but after the service that I received on that day and the fact that this is the second time that I have had poor service like this at this location, I am beginning to believe what people are saying about their staff and how they treat minorities is true.

The worst. I am in the restaurant business. My family, plus fiance were celebrating 2 birthdays. The server Jacob was nice at first, then he got more tables. Waited 30 min for our order to be taken., so we politely asked for a manager. Over 10 minutes later, the "manager" took out order on what looked liked a scrap of paper. We asked for another server, as two tables that sat AFTER us left from being neglected and not having even an app. Tables that sat over an hour later (than my party) got apps, full meals and drinks. We were the 1st in his section. We were never checked on. Management never did anything and our food was COLD. My French dip was soggie. The burgers were hockey pucks, when we ordered rare. Plus...we got charged gratuity? We were 5 people. Not checked on. No service and ignored. Let's not forget that we asked for change of service!!!! I am appaled. It ruined two birthdays and an engagement announcement. What a waste of 200 dollars. Oh, did I mention the beer draft system was down? The server....if you can call him that....Jacob said it was down for two weeks. Shall I mention no Kettle One, Stoli or New Amsterdamn? I am appaled. I have been a server/manager/bartender for 20 years. How do you run a restaurant like this? P.s. we tried to make a reservation, plus showed up 45 min. Early.
